0.title: Hardik should bat in top 5 in any white-ball format: Vaughan
0.article_body: Michael Vaughan lauded Hardik Pandya following his 51(33) in first T20I against England, saying the India all-rounder should bat in the top five in any white-ball format. "If he bats in...top five then it gives so much depth as India can then play an extra batter...pacer or spinner depending on conditions," he added. Hardik batted at number five in Southampton.

1.title: 50 bovines die of suffocation after being locked in J'khand building
1.article_body: Nearly 50 bovines died of suffocation after being locked in a room of an abandoned school building in Jharkhand's Pakur district, the police said. "There were two windows in the room, but both were closed. There was no ventilation," Block Animal Husbandry Officer Farhat Jabbar said. Notably, villagers have been keeping their bovines in the building for years, officials said.

2.title: Chinese forces hold military drills as US Senator visits Taiwan
2.article_body: Chinese forces on Friday held military drills around the Taiwan Strait, PLA's Eastern Theater Command said. The drills come at the same time as US Senator Rick Scott's three-day Taiwan visit during which he is expected to meet President Tsai Ing-wen. A top Chinese general on Thursday had asked the US to cease military "collusion" with Taiwan.

3.title: JEE Main results to be out by July 10: Official
3.article_body: Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main 2022 session 1 results will be announced by July 10 and will be available on jeemain.nta.nic.in, an official said. In this year's B.E/B.Tech. (paper I) answer key, four questions have been dropped. JEE Main 2022 was held online this year from June 23 to 29 across over 500 centres in India and abroad.

4.title: Former TN minister R Kamaraj booked in disproportionate assets case
4.article_body: Tamil Nadu legislator and former Food and Civil Supplies Minister R Kamaraj was booked in a disproportionate assets case on Friday, for allegedly amassing ₹58 crore beyond known sources of income. Anti-corruption officials raided 49 locations associated to Kamaraj, including his residences in Thiruvarur and Chennai. Kamaraj's two sons and three associates have also been booked in the case.

5.title: Thousands of people visit Kerala's Lulu malls amid 'midnight sale', pics go viral
5.article_body: In a bid to renew 'nightlife shopping', Lulu International Shopping Mall in Kerala had announced midnight sales. Videos and photos of people visiting their outlets in Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram in huge numbers have surfaced online. A video also showed a confrontation between a crowd of shoppers and the mall's security staff.

6.title: J&K LG cancels SI recruitment drive, recommends CBI probe
6.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Friday cancelled the recruitment drive for police sub-inspectors in the state and recommended a CBI investigation into the allegations of irregularities in the selection process. "Govt will soon decide future course of action for fresh recruitment," he said in a tweet. Sinha had ordered a probe into the allegations on June 9.

7.title: Video of Ganguly dancing near London Eye to celebrate 50th birthday goes viral
7.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Sourav Ganguly dancing near the London Eye to celebrate his 50th birthday. In the video, Ganguly can be seen dancing with his friends and family, while his daughter Sana can be seen sitting. "Sana is so embarrassed," someone can be heard saying in the video.

8.title: Don't know how India lost it: Sourav Ganguly on Edgbaston Test
8.article_body: Reacting to India's seven-wicket defeat against England in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I don't know how India lost that game." India had set a target of 378 runs, which England chased in 76.4 overs. Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow smashed hundreds in the fourth innings to help England win.

9.title: AAP leader booked for assault in Chandigarh
9.article_body: An Aam Aadmi Party ward councillor in Chandigarh has been booked for allegedly assaulting a private contractor and his driver. According to the police complaint, Councillor Ram Chander Yadav attacked contractor Pardeep Bansal after the latter demanded payment for furniture work done at Ward 15 Community Centre. Yadav denied the charge, saying the police was working for the BJP.

10.title: Stunned, outraged & deeply saddened: Biden on Abe's assassination
10.article_body: Reacting to the assassination of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, US President Joe Biden on Friday said, "I am stunned, outraged, and deeply saddened by the news." "This is a tragedy for Japan and for all who knew him," he added. "His vision of a free and open Indo-Pacific will endure," he further said.

11.title: Ranveer Singh's '83' to be felicitated at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
11.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' will be felicitated at the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. Former Indian skipper Kapil Dev, who is portrayed by Ranveer in the film, will be the guest of honour at the festival. The festival was held virtually for the last two years but will make a physical comeback this year with both in-person and online programs.

12.title: After 4-year gap, Dalai Lama to visit Leh on July 15
12.article_body: The Dalai Lama will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on July 15, amidst deteriorating ties between India and China over the eastern Ladakh military standoff. Beijing has repeatedly objected to the Tibetan leader’s visit to the region. The Dalai Lama, 87, will impart teachings and is expected to stay for about a month in Leh.

13.title: Man arrested for selling fake high security number plates in Chandigarh
13.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly selling illegal high security number plates in Chandigarh's Sector 38, officials said. The accused, Tushar Aggarwal, a resident of Sector 41, was sent to two days of police custody on Thursday. Officials said fake high security number plates of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal and Chandigarh were seized from the accused.

14.title: Flood warning in Karnataka's Belagavi, Bagalkote districts amid heavy rains
14.article_body: Flood warnings have been sounded in Bagalkote and Belagavi districts of Karnataka due to heavy rainfall in neighbouring Maharashtra. "Owing to heavy rains in Maharashtra, water discharge by the neighbouring state into the Krishna river and its tributaries has increased," Karnataka Water Resources Minister Govind Karjol said. The inflow into Almatti Dam has crossed 75,200 cusecs, he added.

15.title: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak announces candidacy for UK Prime Minister
15.article_body: The UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Friday announced that he's standing to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and UK's Prime Minister. "Someone has to grip this moment and make the right decisions," Sunak said. The development comes a day after Boris Johnson resigned after over 50 Members of Parliament resigned in protest at his leadership.

16.title: PM Modi pens tribute for Shinzo Abe, says 'We mourn his passing as one of our own'
16.article_body: PM Narendra Modi penned a heartfelt tribute for Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe following his assassination on Friday. "I first met him in 2007...Right from that first meeting, our friendship went beyond...the shackles of official protocol," he wrote. He added, "We in India mourn his passing as one of our own, just as he embraced us with an open heart."

17.title: Anguished: PM Modi after cloudburst near Amarnath cave in J&K kills 10
17.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish after a cloudburst was reported from the lower reaches of Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. PM Modi also spoke to J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and took stock of the situation. "All possible assistance is being provided to the affected," he said on Twitter. Ten deaths have been reported in the incident.

18.title: India has lost a great friend: Kangana, Anupam condole Shinzo Abe's demise
18.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to condole former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's demise. She wrote, "Sad day. India lost a great friend. Om Shanti." Veteran actor Anupam Kher tweeted, "Deeply saddened & shocked by the assassination of former PM of Japan #ShinzoAbe! He was one of the most compassionate world leaders! And a great friend of India!"

19.title: He is the best spinner in the world right now: Swann on Chahal
19.article_body: Speaking about Yuzvendra Chahal, ex-England spinner Graeme Swann stated the 31-year-old Indian is the best spinner in the world right now. "In T20 cricket, I think it's absolutely unarguable, he  absolutely is," he added. Chahal posted bowling figures of 4-0-32-2 against England in the first T20I in Southampton. The visitors defeated England by 50 runs on Thursday.

20.title: Russia has barely started its action: President Putin to Ukraine
20.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday warned the Ukrainian government that Russia has barely started its action in Ukraine. Putin said, "We have heard many times that the West wants to fight us to the last Ukrainian." "This is a tragedy for the Ukrainian people, but it seems that everything is heading towards this," he added.

21.title: I work to keep myself busy, I don't need money: Neetu Kapoor
21.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor stated in an interview that she is working to keep herself busy and happy, adding that she doesn't need money. "At this age, I don't need to be famous...The time when I wanted things has passed," she added. The actress further said that she enjoys talking to media persons and journalists and even remembers their names now.

22.title: Common man should get priority over VIPs: Maha CM to police
22.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday instructed the police that his convoy does not require a special protocol and asked them not to hold up traffic for his convoy across the state. "This is a government of the common man so he should get priority over VIPs," Shinde said. It causes traffic snarls and burdens the police force, he added.

23.title: Difficult to believe that Japan's ex-PM Abe is no more: Prez Kovind
23.article_body: Expressing grief over the assassination of ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe, President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted, "I find it difficult to believe that...Abe is no more." "He was a great statesman, & his infectious affability endeared him the world over," he added. "That he fell prey to an assassin's bullet is a tragedy for the whole humanity," he further said.

24.title: Dare TMC to arrest me: BJP's Dilip Ghosh on remarks on WB CM
24.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh dared the TMC government to arrest him for his comments on Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. "TMC is falling on the feet of the governor so that I can be arrested. They are shameless!" Ghosh tweeted. Ghosh's comment comes after a TMC delegation met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar and sought action against him.

25.title: Maharashtra is the engine of India's economy: Deputy CM Fadnavis
25.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that "Maharashtra is the engine of India's economy". He said, "We made...pledge in 2015 to grow to a trillion-dollar economy by 2030. I renew that pledge today under Maharashtra's CM Eknath Shinde's leadership." "If we keep progressing as a nation, we can become a seven trillion economy," he added.

26.title: 19-year-old man feared drowned in river in Thane's Bhiwandi
26.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Mohammad Asif, was feared drowned in a river in Thane's Bhiwandi on Friday, an official from the fire brigade said. "The incident took place at Bhiwandi's Kamwari river...around 1 pm when the victim...had ventured into the water for a swim along with four others," the official said. Asif was swept away by strong currents, he added.

27.title: Redmi K50i 5G outscores iPhone 13 in AnTuTu benchmark score: Redmi India
27.article_body: Redmi India announced today that its upcoming smartphone, Redmi K50i 5G has outscored iPhone 13 in AnTuTu scores. The brand tweeted its benchmark score of 8,22,274 points, as compared to 7,82,653 points scored by iPhone 13's A15 chipset (4-core). The smartphone is reportedly powered by the flagship MediaTek Dimensity 8100 and will be launched in India on July 20.

28.title: Man dies by suicide inside washroom of PVR Cinemas in Delhi: Reports
28.article_body: A man in his 40s allegedly died by suicide inside the washroom of PVR Cinemas in Delhi's Vikaspuri on Friday, as per reports. An Aadhaar card was found in the pocket of the deceased, on the basis of which he was identified. So far, the reason behind the suicide has not been ascertained, reports further stated.

29.title: Cloudburst near Amarnath cave in J&K kills 5, video shows tents coming under flash floods
29.article_body: A cloudburst has been reported from the lower reaches of Amarnath cave in Jammu & Kashmir. Some tents have come under flash floods and five deaths have been reported. Rescue operation is in progress and the injured are being airlifted for treatment. The situation is under control, said IGP Kashmir, Vijay Kumar.

30.title: India's Prannoy beats world no. 14 Tsuneyama to enter Malaysia Masters semis
30.article_body: India's HS Prannoy entered the semi-final of Malaysia Masters 2022 after beating world number 14 Kanta Tsuneyama 25-23, 22-20 on Friday. The 29-year-old won the quarter-final match in one hour. Unseeded Prannoy, who is the only Indian left in the tournament, will face eighth seeded Ng Ka Long Angus. Hong Kong's Long Angus defeated Chou Tien Chen 13-21, 21-12, 21-13.

31.title: Ashneer Grover and his wife incorporate new company called 'Third Unicorn'
31.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain have incorporated a new company named 'Third Unicorn Private Limited'. The company was incorporated on July 6 and lists Ashneer and Madhuri as Directors. Madhuri was previously the Head of Controls at BharatPe. On his 40th birthday last month, Ashneer had tweeted, "Time to disrupt another sector. It's time for...Third Unicorn."

32.title: Krawczyk and Skupski win 2nd straight mixed doubles title at Wimbledon
32.article_body: Number two seeds Desirae Krawczyk and Neal Skupski won their second straight mixed doubles Wimbledon title by defeating Australia's Sam Stosur and Matt Ebden 6-4, 6-3 in the final on Thursday. Notably, the British-American duo became the first pair to defend a mixed doubles title since Czech brother-sister duo Cyril Suk and Helena Sukova in 1997.

33.title: Who are the 5 Indian-Americans on Forbes list of richest self-made women in US?
33.article_body: Jayshree Ullal, CEO of Arista Networks, is the richest Indian-American on Forbes list of America's richest self-made women with $1.9 billion net worth. The list features Syntel Co-founder Neerja Sethi and Confluent Co-founder Neha Narkhede with $1 billion and $490 million fortune, respectively. PepsiCo's ex-CEO Indra Nooyi, who's worth $320 million, is the 4th richest Indian-American on the list.

34.title: Cyber crimes against India initiated by 2 hacker groups after Nupur Sharma incident
34.article_body: In the aftermath of Nupur Sharma incident, two hacker groups namely 'DragonForce Malaysia' and 'Hacktivist Indonesia' initiated a cyber war against India, said Amit Vasava, DCP, Cyber Crime, Ahmedabad. "Over two thousand websites were hacked...Ahmedabad Cyber Crime has written to Malaysian and Indonesian governments along with writing to Interpol for lookout notice for both groups," Vasava added.

35.title: 7 MP college students fined for chanting Hanuman Chalisa; minister orders probe
35.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said that no fine will be imposed on the seven students of Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) in Bhopal for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. "If Hanuman Chalisa is not chanted in Hindustan, then where?" he added. Mishra further said that he has asked the District Collector to probe the matter.

36.title: Actor Vikram did not have cardiac arrest, doctors confirm
36.article_body: After Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised, his doctors confirmed in a statement that he did not suffer cardiac arrest and is clinically stable. It further stated that the actor will be discharged from the hospital soon. Vikram was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Friday after complaining of discomfort in his chest. His publicist said that he had high fever.

37.title: Ram Charan & I don't want children for population control: Upasana
37.article_body: Actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela said that the couple does not want to have children for population control. She further said the 'RRR' in her life stands for relationship, reproduction and role in life. Earlier, Ram Charan spoke about it, saying he has the responsibility of making fans happy and having children will deviate him from his mission.

38.title: Pained to learn about assassination of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe: Shah
38.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday expressed grief over the assassination of former PM of Japan, Shinzo Abe. Taking to Twitter, Shah said, "Pained to learn about the assassination of...India's valued friend, Shinzo Abe. His efforts in strengthening...India-Japan relationship will always be held fondly in our memories." "My deepest condolences to his family...and...people of Japan," he added.

40.title: ED summons Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
40.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday issued summons to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's wife Poonam Jain to appear before it at its headquarters for questioning on July 14 in connection with a money laundering case. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

41.title: That's snake sh*t: Doja on Noah sharing private chat about Joseph
41.article_body: Singer Doja Cat criticised actor Noah Schnapp in an Instagram Live session for sharing their private chat about actor Joseph Quinn in a TikTok post. She said, "[It's] so unbelievably like socially unaware and wack...that's like borderline snake sh*t, that's like weasel sh*t." Doja further said that when people are young, they do "dumb sh*t" and "f*ck up relationships".

42.title: TCS Q1 profit rises 5.21% y-o-y to ₹9,478 cr, revenue at ₹52,758 cr
42.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reported a 5.21% rise in its net profit at ₹9,478 crore for the April-June quarter of FY23, compared to ₹9,008 crore from the same quarter a year ago. The company's revenue rose by 16.2% year-on-year to ₹52,758 crore. TCS has also declared an interim dividend of ₹8 per share.

43.title: Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case
43.article_body: Steve Bannon, talk show host and former White House advisor to former President Donald Trump, looks on as he leaves an appearance in U.S. District Court in Washington, U.S., November 15, 2021. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque. Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case. Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case.

44.title: India goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu marries longtime girlfriend Devenish, shares pic
44.article_body: Indian men's football team goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu married his longtime girlfriend Devenish Singh. Sharing a picture from the wedding on social media, he wrote, "Signed the most important contract of my life. Our lives, now. The thought of spending the rest of our days together ends up making everyday after this one, the happiest of our lives."

45.title: I don't have any idea what it is, don't really like that silly term: McCullum on 'Bazball'
45.article_body: Talking about the term 'Bazball' used to describe England's attacking style in Test cricket, England head coach Brendon McCullum, who is nicknamed Baz, said, "I don't have any idea what Bazball is." He added, "I don't really like that silly term...because there's actually quite a bit of thought that goes into how the guys manufacture their performances."

46.title: Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan to remain a playground: Cong MLA
46.article_body: Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan on Friday said that the Idgah Maidan in Chamarajpet locality of Bengaluru will remain a playground forever. "Everyone demanded that the playground must be preserved. Where has the playground gone? Who has tried to remove it? Whether MLA, BBMP or Wakf Board have stated that the playground will cease to exist here?" Zameer questioned.

47.title: Beating Novak in Slam not easy: Murray on Norrie's chances in Wimbledon semis
47.article_body: Talking about compatriot Cameron Norrie's chances against three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic in the semi-final at Wimbledon, Great Britain's Andy Murray said it's going to be an "unbelievably difficult challenge" for the ninth seed. "To beat someone like Novak in a Slam is not easy, but Cam [Norrie] is playing well and he'll be confident," he added.

48.title: Saddened to know about demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Kejriwal
48.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed condolences and said he is saddened to know about the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "The world has lost a great leader. May the departed soul rest in peace," Kejriwal tweeted. Shinzo Abe was shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara.

49.title: Articles call 'Dhaakad' flop, no one talks about 'Radhe Shyam', '83': Kangana
49.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recently wrote on Instagram Stories that hundreds of articles are calling 'Dhaakad' a flop. She shared a screenshot of an article calling 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', '83', 'Radhe Shyam' and 'JugJugg Jeeyo' flops, writing, "No one is talking about these big disasters...any specific reason?" Kangana wrote in another story that the negative PR for 'Dhaakad' has not stopped.

50.title: Sindhu loses to Tai Tzu for 2nd time in 2 weeks at Malaysia Masters
50.article_body: Ex-world champion PV Sindhu crashed out of Malaysia Masters 2022 after losing to Tai Tzu Ying 13-21, 21-12, 12-21 in the quarter-final on Friday. This was seventh seeded Sindhu's seventh straight loss to second seeded Tai Tzu and 17th defeat in 22 matches. Notably, Sindhu lost to Tai Tzu in the quarter-final at Malaysia Open last week.

51.title: Thieves cut hole in wall, steal jewellery worth ₹65 lakh from shop in Guj
51.article_body: Police said a jewellery showroom in Gujarat's Vapi was robbed of gold ornaments worth ₹65.94 lakh on Thursday night after thieves entered by cutting a hole in a wall. It was a planned robbery as the thieves allegedly rented a shop sharing a wall with the showroom, police added. All the jewellery items that were on display were reportedly missing.

52.title: No one can take away Sena's 'bow & arrow' symbol: Uddhav Thackeray
52.article_body: Maharashtra's former CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said the 'bow and arrow' symbol will always remain with the party. "There's a discussion going on about the party's symbol. As per the law, no one can take away 'bow and arrow' from Shiv Sena," he added. Thackeray further demanded that mid-term elections should be held in Maharashtra.

53.title: 2 unidentified men attempt to break into ATMs in Thane, case filed
53.article_body: Police on Thursday said two unidentified persons allegedly attempted to break into two ATMs in Thane's Bhiwandi. The accused tried to open the machines using a screwdriver to remove cash, police said, adding both the machines were damaged. A case has been registered under IPC sections 380 (theft), 511 (attempt to commit offence) and 427 (mischief causing damage), they added.

54.title: Bengaluru Police raid fake call centre in Whitefield, 6 detained
54.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Friday detained six people and seized items worth ₹2 crore during a raid on a fake call centre in Whitefield. The seized items include 127 desktops, four laptops, 10 internal hard disks, six iPhones, three luxury cars and ₹18 lakh in cash. The company running the call centre was involved in cybercrimes, according to the police.

55.title: Man robbed of ₹8,000 in Hyderabad, 2 accused held within 24 hours
55.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested two men for allegedly robbing a man of ₹8,000 within 24 hours of the crime. Police said the accused Bommenna Srikar and Vagmera Vijay Kumar approached Mohd Shahzad, pretending to seek directions, while he was on his way home after withdrawing money from an ATM. Police also recovered a two-wheeler and two mobile phones from them.

56.title: GHMC to set up 2 more construction & debris plants in Hyderabad
56.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) announced setting up of two construction and debris waste management plants at Charminar and Secunderabad zones. The civic body has come up with the initiative to prevent construction debris from being discharged in lakes and on footpaths. The GHMC has invited tenders to set up plants within a 10 km distance in the city.

57.title: Waiting for divorce from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP: SBSP chief
57.article_body: Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Friday said he will not initiate any steps to break SBSP's alliance with the Samajwadi Party and that he is waiting for "talaq" (divorce) from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP. Rajbhar added that he is "still with the SP, but will not remain together forcefully if Akhilesh Yadav doesn't want it".

58.title: Andhra CM Reddy's mother quits YSR Cong Party to support daughter in T'gana
58.article_body: YS Vijayamma, mother of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, on Friday resigned as the honorary president of the ruling YSR Congress Party. Vijayamma said she will now support her daughter YS Sharmila, who is heading the YSR Telangana Party in the neighbouring state. "My daughter is fighting alone. If I don’t support her, it'll be injustice," Vijayamma added.

59.title: IAS officer, arrested for sexually harassing IIT student after party in J'khand, suspended
59.article_body: The Jharkhand government on Friday suspended IAS officer Sayyed Riyaj Ahemad, who was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing an IIT student. Ahemad was arrested on Tuesday and sent to judicial custody for two weeks after the engineering student filed a police complaint. He allegedly harassed the girl after attending dinner party hosted at the Deputy Development Commissioner's residence.

60.title: 4 minors blackmail and rape 15-yr-old female classmate in TN; arrested
60.article_body: Four minors were arrested in Tamil Nadu for allegedly raping their 15-year-old female classmate after blackmailing her over attending a function without her parents' knowledge. The accused had allegedly taken photos of the girl with a boy, whose birthday party she was attending. They allegedly took her to one of their homes, raped her and filmed the act, police said.

61.title: Apple's Steve Jobs awarded US' highest civilian honour posthumously
61.article_body: US President Joe Biden presented the Presidential Medal of Freedom, US' highest civilian honour, to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs on Thursday. His wife, Laurene Powell Jobs, accepted the award on his behalf. "His (Jobs') vision, imagination and creativity led to inventions that have, and continue to, change the way the world communicates," the White House earlier said.

62.title: Teakwood smuggling racket busted in MP's Indore
62.article_body: Forest officers have busted a teakwood smuggling racket in Indore. The accused would smuggle the teakwood from the forests and send it to the Narmada river by boat. For the past six months, the forest officials have taken more than half a dozen actions to curb teakwood smuggling. Choral range has been a hotspot for timber smugglers.

63.title: He was a friend of India: Sitharaman on demise of Japan's ex-PM Abe
63.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has expressed grief over the demise of former PM of Japan Shinzo Abe. In a tweet on Friday, Sitharaman said, "Express my profound grief on the tragic demise of...Shinzo Abe. He was a friend of India and we held him in great regard." Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Japan's Nara city.

64.title: Akshay was upset, felt he got a raw deal: Shabbir Boxwala on 'Mohra'
64.article_body: Producer Shabbir Boxwala, while talking about his film 'Mohra', said Akshay Kumar was upset with the film's title. "He felt that the title was biased towards Suniel and...he got a raw deal. However, we reasoned that he had an equally important role," Shabbir added. "Through...song, 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast', the...money he made is mind-boggling," Shabbir further said.

65.title: Kohli should open the batting if he plays in 2nd T20I vs England: Swann
65.article_body: Graeme Swann has said if Virat Kohli returns to India's playing XI in second T20I against England then he should open innings with captain Rohit Sharma. "When you've got a player as good as Virat, you don't want him batting at number three in...middle overs because he isn't going to score as quickly as...Suryakumar Yadav or Deepak Hooda," he added.

66.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX running anti-5G narrative, says US non-profit
66.article_body: US non-profit '5G for 12 GHz Coalition' has accused Elon Musk's SpaceX of initiating a "public misinformation campaign" against 5G. It said that SpaceX lied to customers about how expanding certain airwaves for 5G could disrupt its Starlink satellite internet service. "This tactic, which is commonly used by Musk...promulgates an anti-5G narrative that is harmful to American consumers," it added.

67.title: ED fines Amnesty India ₹51 cr, ex-CEO Aakar Patel ₹10 cr for FEMA violations
67.article_body: Amnesty India International Pvt Ltd and its former CEO Aakar Patel have been fined ₹51.72 crore and ₹10 crore, respectively, the Directorate of Enforcement (ED) said on Friday. The ED added that its Adjudicating Authority has adjudicated a show cause notice to Amnesty India and Patel for contravention of the provisions of FEMA (Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999).

68.title: Steve Smith smashes an international hundred for the first time in 18 months
68.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith on Friday smashed his first hundred in international cricket in 18 months. The 33-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 193 deliveries in the first innings of the second Test against Sri Lanka. Steve Smith has now hit 28 hundreds in Test cricket. Smith has hit five Test hundreds in Asia.

69.title: Great player, superb leader: Harbhajan to Ganguly on his 50th birthday
69.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to wish Sourav Ganguly on his 50th birthday on Friday. "A great player, a superb leader, the BCCI President and my captain...Dada have a wonderful year ahead. Love always!" he wrote. Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Happy Birthday Dada! You've been a great friend, an impactful captain and a senior any youngster would want to learn from."

70.title: Campus Fund raises ₹75 crore to invest in student-led startups
70.article_body: Campus Fund, which invests in student-led startups, announced that it has raised ₹75 crore for its second fund. IIFL Wealth, Omidyar Network India and ex-Chairman of HDFC Securities Bharat Shah were among those who participated in the round. Campus Fund was launched in July 2020. Its first fund had a corpus of ₹7 crore which was invested across 10 startups.

71.title: 12-yr-old girl kidnapped, raped on way home from school in Jharkhand
71.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by two men in Jharkhand's Dumka. She was going home from school to collect a notebook that she had forgotten to carry. The accused, who were in a car, asked her about a river and when she stopped to reply, they abducted her, raped her and dumped her in Godda, the girl told police.

72.title: Bihar man enters classroom with sword after child denied money for uniform
72.article_body: A man in Bihar's Araria district allegedly barged into a school with a sword and threatened teachers after he didn't get money for his child's school uniform, police said. The man also told the teachers that he would return if he did not get the money within 24 hours. An FIR has been registered against the man following the incident.

73.title: Philippine President in isolation after testing +ve for coronavirus
73.article_body: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr is in isolation after testing positive for coronavirus in an antigen test, his spokeswoman said on Friday. People who came into contact with the President, including his son, have tested negative for COVID-19, the spokeswoman added. Notably, this comes after Marcos Jr's meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Wednesday.

74.title: Meta virtual reality headsets to no longer require Facebook for login
74.article_body: Facebook parent company Meta said that it'll no longer require people to sign in to their Facebook accounts to use its virtual reality headsets. CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced a new virtual reality login system that will be launched in August 2022. The users will now be required to create a Meta account as well as a social profile, Meta Horizon.

75.title: Expecting Indian boxers to win 4 golds at CWG 2022: Nikhat Zareen
75.article_body: Newly-crowned world boxing champion Nikhat Zareen has said that she is expecting Indian boxers to win four gold medals in this month's Commonwealth Games in Birmingham. "I expect at least eight medals, of which I will take four gold [for Indian] boxers. Let's see what happens...We have World Championship medallists and Olympians," the 26-year-old boxer said.

76.title: I've smashed sixes all my life but now I feel happier hitting a four: Hardik
76.article_body: Hardik Pandya said he has smashed sixes all his life but now "feels happier" after hitting a four, adding it touches his heart. Hardik smashed 51 off 33 balls in the first T20I against England which comprised six fours and a six. Discussing his bowling, Hardik stated, "I was happier seeing 90.5 mph on the speedometer than my overall performance."

77.title: I'm not going to plan it: Ms Marvel's Iman on future Hollywood plans
77.article_body: Pakistani-Canadian actress Iman Vellani, who plays the titular role in 'Ms Marvel', said that she is not going to plan her future in Hollywood. "I didn't even know I could do this. 'Ms Marvel' came out of nowhere...I'm just going to see where life takes me," she added. The actress further said that she is just going with the flow.

78.title: 'Thor: Love...' earns ₹18.6 cr on day 1, more than Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2, Prithviraj
78.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder' earned ₹18.60 crore on day one of release in India, film trade analyst Taran Adarsh said. Hindi films such as 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Samrat Prithviraj' opened at ₹14.1 crore and ₹10.7 crore, respectively. The film, starring Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale, has been released in English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam in India.

79.title: Web3 projects have lost more than $2 bn to hacks this yr: Report
79.article_body: Web3 projects have lost more than $2 billion to hacks and exploits in the first half of 2022, more than all of 2021 combined, blockchain auditing and security company CertiK reported. About $308 million was lost across 27 flash loan attacks in the June quarter, while $14 million was lost to flash loans in Q1.

80.title: 25 students rescued after T'gana school bus gets submerged in floodwater
80.article_body: At least 25 school students were rescued by local residents after a bus carrying them got submerged in floodwater in Telangana's Mahabubnagar district on Friday. The bus of a private school was passing under a railway bridge when it got stuck midway. After the rescue of the children, the bus was reportedly pulled out with the help of a tractor.

81.title: When India bowls, Rohit as skipper makes huge impression: Jaffer
81.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that limited-overs skipper Rohit Sharma makes a "huge impression" as captain when India is "bowling". "The changes that he [Rohit] makes and the calls that he takes, that makes a huge difference," Jaffer said. "What we've seen of Arshdeep Singh [in the first T20I], I would have given him another game," Jaffer added.

82.title: Volkswagen, partners to invest $20 billion to produce EV batteries
82.article_body: German automobile manufacturer Volkswagen said the company along with its partners will invest over $20 billion to produce electric vehicle (EV) batteries. This will result in the creation of 20,000 jobs and annual sales of above $20 billion by 2030, it added. The announcement was made at the groundbreaking ceremony of the company's first battery plant in Europe.

83.title: PMC to hire pvt agency for mechanical cleaning of Pune's public toilets
83.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to hire a private agency to clean the city's public toilets using machines. Earlier, the cleaning of toilets was managed by the PMC staff but now it will be handled by an agency for five years, officials said. "The contractor will be responsible for toilets' cleaning, water supply, proper functioning of doors," an official said.

84.title: It doesn't bother me: Nikki on being trolled for crying on Moosewala's death
84.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has opened up about being trolled for crying at the airport post Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's death. "I was very sad when I heard about his death and...broke into tears. It was a natural reaction," Nikki said. "Whether I laugh or cry, I still get trolled, it doesn't bother me now," she added.

85.title: 'Oo Antava' hotter than 'Tip Tip', but Katrina is a better dancer: Ranveer
85.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, during the rapid-fire round on 'Koffee With Karan season 7', said that Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Oo Antava' was hotter than Katrina Kaif's 'Tip Tip'. "I think that's (Oo Antava) the hotter song. So, I prefer that as a song and I prefer the choreography," he said. Ranveer, however, added that Katrina is a better dancer.

86.title: The ball kept sailing over our heads: Russel on Dhoni's 183* vs SL
86.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni's 183* against Sri Lanka, ex-Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said, "Sachin Tendulkar was out in the first over and Virender Sehwag was out early too, but then India sprung a surprise." "Dhoni came and quietly took control...The...buzz we had...started disappearing...The ball kept sailing over [our] heads...Each time he hit the ball, it went...further away," he added.

87.title: MCD identifies over 200 houses as unsafe amid monsoon rains in Delhi
87.article_body: NDMC and the MCD surveyed over 26 lakh properties in Delhi to identify hazardous structures that could collapse during the rainy season and ensure their destruction or rehabilitation. Out of over 26 lakh properties surveyed, 266 houses in Delhi were deemed unsafe and owners were given notices, an official said. Reportedly, North Delhi had the maximum number of dangerous buildings.

88.title: Pune civic body to allocate space for organic food stalls in markets
88.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to allocate space for organic food stalls in the city's marketplaces. The decision has been taken in view of the state government's 'Urban Food System' scheme. "The agriculture companies or groups of farmers can apply...in the PMC...The farmers will have to get their products to market at their own cost," an official said.

89.title: Cut edible oil prices by ₹15 per litre immediately: Govt to edible oil associations
89.article_body: The government has directed leading edible oil associations to cut prices of edible oils by ₹15 per litre with immediate effect. The Centre has advised manufacturers and refiners to reduce the price of oils to distributors. "Whenever a reduction in price to distributors is made by...manufactures or refiners, the benefit should be passed on to the consumers," the government said.

90.title: 'Friends' co-creator apologizes for misgendering Chandler's trans parent
90.article_body: Marta Kauffman, co-creator of American TV show 'Friends', has apologised for misgendering character Chandler Bing's transgender parent, Charles Bing, in the show. Kauffman told Fox News, "Pronouns weren't yet something that I understood. So...we didn't refer to that character as 'she'." "That was a mistake," Kauffman said, adding she regrets referring to Charles as Chandler's father.

91.title: Chilean hockey player proposes to boyfriend after scoring in women's WC, video viral
91.article_body: Chilean hockey player Francisca Tala proposed to her boyfriend after scoring a goal in her team's women's hockey World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands. "I made a bet with the girls that if I made a goal against the Netherlands, I had to marry my boyfriend," she said. Chile have reached the cross-over round in the ongoing World Cup.

92.title: Need over ₹2,000 cr monthly, ED trying to disrupt business: Vivo on frozen accounts
92.article_body: Referring to the Enforcement Directorate freezing its bank accounts, Vivo told the Delhi High Court that it has to make monthly payments of around ₹2,826 crore towards statutory dues, salaries, rent and daily business operations. It added that ED has undertaken a "roving and fishing enquiry” against it and continues to make "various attempts to disrupt" its business.

93.title: Russian bank reusing bank card chips to combat shortage amid Ukraine war
93.article_body: Russian bank SberBank has started reusing chips from un-activated bank cards to combat a shortage resulting from European suppliers halting deliveries amid the Ukraine war. "A shortage of chips for cards has started in Russia. We mostly worked with European chip producers...there is now a big problem with logistics from Europe," SberBank's head of cyber compliance Olga Maklashina said.

94.title: Jacqueline to play actress Priya Rajvansh in director Pradeep Sarkar's next
94.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez will play the role of actress Priya Rajvansh in her and filmmaker Chetan Anand's biopic. The film will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar and produced by Deepak Mukut. Notably, Priya Rajvansh worked exclusively for Chetan Anand and had starred in films including 'Haqeeqat', 'Heer Raanjha' and 'Hanste Zakhm'. She died on March 27, 2000.

95.title: Alia wishes Neetu Kapoor on her b'day, shares pic from her haldi ceremony
95.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to share a post marking Neetu Kapoor's birthday. Sharing a picture from her haldi ceremony, Alia wrote, "Happiest birthday to the most beautiful soul...My mother-in-law/friend/soon-to-be dadi maaaaa...love you so so much!" Neetu turned 64 on Friday. Alia is expecting her first child with her husband, actor Ranbir Kapoor.

96.title: Who is Indian-origin Suella Braverman, who said she seeks to be UK's next PM?
96.article_body: Indian-origin UK MP Suella Braverman has publicly announced that she intends to seek the position of UK's Prime Minister after Boris Johnson's resignation. The 42-year-old is the UK's second female Attorney General who was appointed as the country's top legal official in February 2020. Braverman has studied Law at Queens' College, Cambridge and was called to the Bar in 2005.

97.title: Russia threatens to 'take back' Alaska from US
97.article_body: The Speaker of Russia's Lower House of Parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, has threatened to "take back" Alaska from US if the country froze or seized Russian assets as punishment for its invasion of Ukraine. Russia colonised Alaska and established several settlements there until the US purchased it from Russia in 1867 for $7.2 million.

98.title: Actor Vikram admitted to hospital, team refutes reports of heart attack
98.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised on Friday and his publicist confirmed that the actor was taken to hospital after he complained of discomfort due to high fever symptoms. Contrary to some reports that claimed that Vikram suffered a heart attack and was therefore admitted to the hospital, his publicist said it was high fever and he's doing fine.

99.title: India lost a close friend today: Rajnath on ex-Japan PM Abe's assassination
99.article_body: Expressing grief over former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination on Friday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "India today has lost a close friend who assiduously worked towards strengthening bilateral relations." "I met with Mr Abe...in 2019. I found him to be an inspiring leader who had the vision to create a safe and better world," Singh added.

100.title: He could play for another 10 years: Finch on 35-yr-old David Warner
100.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch said 35-year-old Australian batter David Warner could play for another 10 years considering his fitness. "He loves the competition and [continues] to challenge himself," added Finch. "I can't believe people wrote Warner off...It was almost like poking the bear," Finch had said after Australia's triumph in the men's T20 World Cup 2021.

101.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav's health is improving: Daughter Misa Bharti
101.article_body: RJD leader Misa Bharti tweeted that the health of her father Lalu Prasad Yadav is improving. She also shared some photos of the RJD chief from hospital and wrote, "Lalu Ji's condition is much better...because of his morale and your prayers. Please don't pay attention to rumours." Lalu was hospitalised with severe injuries and airlifted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday.

102.title: ED raids 18 places linked to J'khand CM Soren's close aide over tender scam
102.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday conducted raids at 18 locations in Jharkhand as part of a money-laundering investigation against MLA Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Chief Minister Hemant Soren, officials said. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged scam carried out while availing marketplace tender in Sahibganj's Barharwa in 2020.

103.title: Pics of late actor James Caan with Pacino from The Godfather's premiere go viral
103.article_body: Following the demise of James Caan, the late actor's pictures from the premiere of 'The Godfather' in 1972 have gone viral on social media. In the pictures, Caan can be seen interacting with Al Pacino and Ali MacGraw. The actor passed away aged 82. Mourning his demise, Pacino said, "Hard to believe that he won't be in the world anymore."

104.title: Hazlewood's IPL stint with CSK helped his T20 game: Aaron Finch
104.article_body: Australia limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch has said that pacer Josh Hazlewood's stint with Chennai Super Kings improved his T20 game. "For such a long time Hazlewood's focus was just on Test cricket...I think he got that in the lead-up to the last T20 World Cup while playing all 14 games for CSK," Finch said.

105.title: On-duty ITBP officer shoots himself dead in J&K's Poonch
105.article_body: An on-duty ITBP officer posted in J&K shot himself dead with his service weapon on Friday, officials said. The deceased personnel has been identified as Assistant Sub-Inspector Prem Chand, officials added. The incident took place at the Mini Secretariat in Poonch town, according to officials. They further informed that Chand was taken to the hospital where he was declared dead.

106.title: PCMC launches WhatsApp Chatbot to resolve public grievances in 6hrs
106.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has launched 'WhatsApp Chatbot' to address the public grievances related to civic services like waste collection and sewage accumulation. Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane said the administration will try to resolve the complaints in six hours. Reportedly, PCMC resolved more than 500 complaints via WhatsApp Chatbot in a single day.

107.title: 27-yr-old man held for opening fire at a person at gym in Delhi
107.article_body: A 27-year-old man has been arrested for opening fire at a person at a gym in Delhi's Patel Nagar area, police said. The incident took place after the victim had an argument with the man's girlfriend a few days ago, police added. The victim received a gunshot injury in the stomach and was rushed to a hospital, police further said.

108.title: Tesla sells record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June
108.article_body: Tesla sold record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June, including 968 for export, the China Passenger Car Association said. The automaker sold 32,165 vehicles and exported 22,340 in May. The overall passenger car sales in China in June totalled 1.97 million, up 22% from a year earlier. Out of the total sales, electric cars accounted for 27%.

109.title: North Korean hackers targeting US hospitals with Maui ransomware: US
109.article_body: The US government agencies, in an advisory, said that North Korean government-sponsored cyber hackers have used a ransomware, known as Maui, since May 2021 to target US health organisations. According to cybersecurity firm Chainalysis, these hackers made at least $731 million in 2021. The advisory noted that the ransomware disrupted the healthcare services "for prolonged periods".

110.title: Deeply saddened by demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Rahul
110.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday expressed condolences and said that he's "deeply saddened" by the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "[Abe's] role in strengthening...strategic relationship between India and Japan was commendable," he added. He further said that Abe has left behind a "lasting legacy in...Indo-Pacific". Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Nara city.

111.title: Even in Australia, spin will play big part in T20 WC 2022: Finch
111.article_body: Australia white-ball captain Aaron Finch has said that spin bowling will play a big part, especially in the middle overs, during this year's ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. "Spin is always going to have an impact...especially on bigger grounds in Australia. Here you have got to hit it in a way to get it to the boundary," Finch said.

112.title: Edtech platform Gurusiksha raises ₹50 lakh in its 1st funding round
112.article_body: Online tutoring and mentoring platform Gurusiksha has secured ₹50 lakh from angel investors in its first funding round. The startup plans to raise another funding round later this year. The newly-raised funds will be deployed for purposes like business expansion and adding more courses, the company said. Founded in 2016 by Dipak Jha, Gurusiksha claims to operate across India.

113.title: Bullet train project chief Satish Agnihotri fired over charges of corruption
113.article_body: The Railways has terminated the services of NHSRCL MD Satish Agnihotri, who was in charge of the government's bullet train project, following a Lokpal court order directing the CBI to probe corruption allegations against him. According to officials, there were several allegations against Agnihotri, including misuse of his official position and diverting funds illegally to a private company.

114.title: Delhi govt guarantees startup incubation for Business Blasters winners
114.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday tweeted that the Delhi government will be guaranteeing admission to colleges and incubation for startups to students who got successful in the Business Blasters initiative. Under the initiative, a total of 51,000 business ideas were proposed by around three lakh students from Classes 11 and 12, out of which 126 got investor funding.

115.title: NASA shares pic from world's biggest telescope, says 'Unexpected view of the universe'
115.article_body: NASA has shared a picture captured by the Fine Guidance Sensor (FGS) of the world's biggest telescope, James Webb Space Telescope. "Talk about an overachiever! Gaze at this test image...an unexpected & deep view of the universe," NASA wrote alongside the picture. NASA is expected to release the first full-colour images from the telescope next week.

116.title: Bullet that killed former Japan PM Shinzo Abe 'reached his heart': Doctors
116.article_body: The bullet that killed former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe "reached his heart", doctors at Nara Medical University, who were treating him said in a news conference on Friday. Abe was bleeding profusely and doctors couldn't stop the bleeding, medical officials said. He was pronounced dead at 5:03 pm local time, officials added.

117.title: Water supply disrupted in Delhi due to high ammonia levels in Yamuna
117.article_body: Water supply was disrupted in parts of Delhi on Friday, due to a rise in ammonia levels in the Yamuna river, according to the Delhi Jal Board (DJB). Operations at the Wazirabad, Chandrawal and Okhla water treatment plants have been affected. Water supply will remain affected till the situation improves, the DJB had earlier said.

118.title: I shouldn't have been so greedy as an actor: Amar on quitting 'Kyunki...'
118.article_body: Amar Upadhyay said he quit TV show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' as he had signed three movies. "When I left Kyunki, it was a hard decision," he added. Further, while regretting his decision, Amar said that he shouldn't have been so greedy as an actor. "Today, I would've stuck to Kyunki and told them to wait," Amar added.

119.title: Hardik surprised England's best batters, bossed 1st T20I totally: Jaffer
119.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Hardik Pandya, who became the first Indian to score a half-century and record a four-wicket haul in a T20I, during the first T20I against England "totally bossed" the match. "He hit that deck hard...bowled that channel which is hard to hit and surprised [England's best batters]," added Jaffer. Hardik smashed 51 runs off 33 balls.

120.title: 80-yr-old woman found dead with her throat slit in Delhi; probe on
120.article_body: An 80-year-old woman was found dead inside her house in Delhi's Shalimar Bagh area on Friday. DCP (Northwest district) Usha Rangnani said the woman was found lying on the bed with her throat partially slit. Rangnani said her ornaments and household articles were found intact, adding that prima facie, it appears the assailant had a friendly entry into the house.

121.title: Fatherhood is certainly life-changing: Nick Jonas on Malti Marie
121.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra's husband singer Nick Jonas recently spoke about his daughter Malti Marie, saying that she is amazing and brings him a lot of joy. He further said, "[Fatherhood] is certainly life-changing." Priyanka and Nick welcomed their daughter via surrogacy in January 2022. Malti Marie was born premature and had to spend over 100 days in the NICU.

122.title: Sanctions over Ukraine a declaration of economic war by West: Russia
122.article_body: The West's attempts to isolate Russia with sanctions are akin to a declaration of economic war, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday. Russia will now turn to China and India and other nations outside the West, he added. Notably, Ukraine and the West have termed Russia's invasion an imperial-style land grab.

123.title: I'll give equal importance to my batting, bowling: Hardik after 1st T20I win
123.article_body: Following his 4/33 and 51 in India's 50-run win against England in first T20I, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said he'd give equal importance to his batting and bowling. "Bowling bit will take more credit because that spell brought us in the game...made it difficult for England to stay in the game," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

124.title: Delhi court frames charges of rioting, attempt to murder against 3 in riots case
124.article_body: A Delhi court has framed charges of rioting, attempt to murder, unlawful assembly and dacoity against three persons in the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. The accused had allegedly attacked a Muslim man with a sword during the riots near Khajuri Khas. No case was made out for offence under IPC section 436 (arson), the court said.

125.title: If anybody can swing the ball in Aus, it'll be Bhuvneshwar: Giles on T20 WC
125.article_body: Talking about Bhuvneshwar Kumar who conceded 10 runs and dismissed Jos Buttler in the first T20I against England, ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said, "If anybody swings [the ball in Australia during T20 World Cup 2022] it'll be Bhuvi." "He has inked his name into [India's] World Cup squad already," added Giles. Bhuvneshwar had an economy rate of 3.33.

126.title: CM Eknath Shinde meets Maha Metro MD, reviews Pune Metro project
126.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday reviewed the Pune Metro project work during a meeting with Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (Maha Metro) Managing Director Brijesh Dixit. CM Shinde was also informed about the current status of the 48.2-km phase two project report of Pune Metro. "The CM has assured...that Pune Metro project would get all possible assistance," Dixit said.

127.title: Cases of typhoid in Hyderabad on increase following monsoon
127.article_body: As monsoon has struck Hyderabad, the cases of typhoid are reportedly on a rise. Hospitals in the city have reported around 10-20 cases per week in the past two weeks. Most of these cases have been reported from Amberpet, Hafeezpet, Banjara Hills, Tolichowki and Mehdipatnam areas. "There's no outbreak of typhoid yet since cases are limited," a doctor said.

128.title: 2 killed, 48 injured as bus falls into 150-foot-deep gorge in J&K
128.article_body: Two persons were killed and 48 others were injured when a bus carrying a wedding procession fell into a 150-foot-deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. "The bus hit a tree while rolling down the gorge, which reduced the impact and, perhaps, saved several lives," a police officer said. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at hospitals.

129.title: PM Modi shares pic from his most recent meeting with Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe
129.article_body: Following the demise of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe after he was shot at, PM Narendra Modi shared a picture with him from their most recent meeting in Tokyo. "Always passionate about strengthening India-Japan ties, he had just taken over as...Chairman of...Japan-India Association," wrote PM Modi. One day national mourning has been announced on July 9 as a mark of respect.

130.title: Teachers' body criticises NCERT for removing chapters on climate change
130.article_body: Teachers Against the Climate Crisis (TACC) has criticised NCERT for removing certain chapters on climate change from the school syllabi. The removed portion includes chapters on the greenhouse effect, weather, climate, water, weather systems and Indian monsoon among others from syllabi of different classes. "We...are deeply dismayed by the many recent changes to school syllabi," TACC said.

131.title: Cong has misused Gandhi's name; brought country to a sorry state: CM Bommai
131.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has accused Congress of misusing Mahatma Gandhi's name and bringing the country to a sorry state. "Congress is in the position of a convict. They bowed to lobbies...They do not have the moral right to preach to others," CM Bommai said. "There are more such scams which Congress has buried. They would be exposed," he added.

132.title: Shinzo Abe shooting is 5th gun attack on Japan politician since 1990: Report
132.article_body: Shooting of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe is the fifth involving a politician of Japan since 1990, said NHK. In 1990, Motoshima Hitoshi, then-mayor of Nagasaki, was injured in an attack. In 1992 and 1994, attacks took place on then-LDP Vice President Kanemaru Shin and ex-PM Hosokawa Morihiro respectively, but both were unharmed. Nagasaki Mayor Ito Itcho was killed in 2007.

133.title: Indian startups' funding fell 33% to $6.9 bn in June quarter: Report
133.article_body: The total funding raised by Indian startups in the June quarter fell 33% to $6.9 billion in 409 funding rounds, Tracxn reported. The startups had raised $10.1 billion in the same quarter last year. The report added that 121 new startups closed their first funding rounds, four startups turned unicorns and 62 got acquired in the quarter.

134.title: PM Modi announces one day national mourning on July 9 as a mark of respect for Abe
134.article_body: After the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "As a mark of our deepest respect for former Prime Minister Abe Shinzo, a one day national mourning shall be observed on 9 July 2022." "I am shocked and saddened beyond words at the tragic demise of one of my dearest friends, Shinzo Abe," he wrote.

135.title: Was unceremoniously dropped from 'Bombay...', my star value wasn't high: Ranveer
135.article_body: Ranveer Singh, during his appearance on 'Koffee with Karan season 7', said that he was "unceremoniously dropped" from 'Bombay Velvet'. "I was unceremoniously dropped because at the time I couldn't justify the budget. My star value wasn't high...But things have changed," he said. The lead role was eventually played by Ranbir Kapoor in the film, which was released in 2015.

136.title: Just wanted to share our joy: Ranbir on pregnancy being called 'promo stunt'
136.article_body: Speaking about his pregnancy announcement with his wife Alia Bhatt being called a "promotional stunt" for their upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor said that they just wanted to share their joy. "Alia and I as a married couple...felt it was the right time. We just wanted to share...the news and there was no other thought to it," he added.

137.title: Physiotherapist arrested for molesting female patient in Greater Noida clinic
137.article_body: A physiotherapist has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 20-year-old woman on the pretext of examining her at the former's clinic in Greater Noida, officials said. Officials added that the woman had gone to the clinic for consultation when the alleged incident took place. According to police, the woman had to run away from the clinic.

138.title: K'taka reports 1,053 new COVID-19 cases, 966 reported in B'luru
138.article_body: Karnataka on Thursday reported 1,053 new coronavirus cases, of which 966 cases were from Bengaluru alone, according to official data. However, the number of new cases recorded in both the state and the city was slightly less than the day before. The city's positivity rate was 4.96% and the number of active clusters was 22, the data revealed.

139.title: Batters were fearless, bowlers very clinical: Laxman on India's 1st T20I win
139.article_body: Praising India after their 50-run win against England in first T20I, VVS Laxman, who coached India, said the batters were fearless and bowlers very clinical. "Fabulous win last night! Proud of the way the boys approached the match right from the start and came out on top of it," he tweeted. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

140.title: Payal, Sangram perform puja at temple in Agra ahead of wedding
140.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi and wrestler Sangram Singh recently performed puja at a temple in Agra. The couple, who is set to tie the knot on July 9, visited Prachin Rajeshwar Mahadev Mandir to seek blessings. Payal's mehendi ceremony was held on July 6, pictures of which were shared by the actress on her Instagram handle.

141.title: Heavy rain increases water levels in 4 Pune dams by 1 TMC in 24hrs
141.article_body: Following heavy rainfall, the water levels in four dams supplying water to Pune have increased by nearly one thousand million cubic feet (TMC) in the last 24 hours. The water storage in four dams Khadakwasla, Panshet, Varasgaon and Temghar has now reached 5.45 TMC. Last week, due to deficit rainfall, the storage in these dams had dropped to 2.5 TMC.

142.title: Rishi Sunak's wife brings tea to reporters waiting outside their home, pic surfaces
142.article_body: Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty was seen serving tea and biscuits to journalists waiting outside their family home in London following Sunak's resignation as UK's Finance Minister. Murty is the daughter of Infosys' billionaire Founder NR Narayana Murthy. Notably, after the resignation of Boris Johnson, Sunak is said to be among the leaders in race to become the next PM.

143.title: BJP shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship Goddess Kali: Moitra
143.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra reacted to BJP criticising her remarks on Goddess Kali, saying that they "shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship" the goddess. BJP should stop imposing its "version of Hinduism...based on established norms of North India" on other parts of India, she added. Earlier, Moitra said that to her, "Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."

144.title: 6 dead, 10 injured as bus crashes into truck in Tamil Nadu; PM expresses grief
144.article_body: Six persons died and over 10 others sustained injuries on Friday morning after the driver of the government bus in which they were travelling rammed into a stationary truck in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu district. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while expressing grief over the loss of lives, said, "My thoughts are with those who have lost their loved ones."

145.title: 5 held in Brazil in $3 bn money laundering case involving crypto
145.article_body: Brazil's federal police carried out 'Operation Greed' on Thursday and arrested five people of a group believed to have laundered money made from illegal gold mining, Reuters reported. The group created its own crypto token and used other methods as well to launder funds, the police said. Over $3 billion moved through the group's bank accounts between 2019-21, it added.

146.title: Former Japan PM Shinzo Abe dies after being shot at during speech
146.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has died after being shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara. Police said that the attacker, identified as 41-year-old Yamagami Tetsuya, told investigators that he was "dissatisfied" with Abe and "intended to kill him". The video of the attacker, who shot Abe from behind, had surfaced on social media.

147.title: Vivo India moves Delhi HC challenging freezing of bank accounts by ED
147.article_body: Vivo India on Friday approached the Delhi High Court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "We have 9,000 employees. There is a liability," said advocate Siddharth Luthra. The ED seized 119 bank accounts of various entities with ₹465 crore including Vivo India's fixed deposits of around ₹66 crore.

148.title: Theranos' Pak-born executive Ramesh Balwani found guilty of fraud in US
148.article_body: Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani, the former President of Theranos and ex-boyfriend of its Founder Elizabeth Holmes, has been found guilty of fraud in US. The Pakistan-born executive was convicted on two counts of conspiracy and 10 counts of fraud. Balwani and Holmes were accused of exaggerating the abilities of Theranos' machines. The startup was valued at $9 billion before its collapse.

149.title: Fintech startup Innoviti raises $45 million in Series D round
149.article_body: Fintech startup Innoviti Payment Solutions has raised $45 million in Series D funding round led by Singapore-based Panthera Growth Partners, which invested $15 million. Investments were also made by existing investors FMO and Bessemer Venture Partners as well as new investors like Alumni Ventures. The Bengaluru-based startup also raised debt from Trifecta Capital as part of the round.

150.title: We are world's 3rd largest startup ecosystem today: PM Modi
150.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the Akhil Bhartiya Shiksha Samagam in Varanasi, stated that India is now the third-largest startup ecosystem in the world. "Not only did we recover so fast from the big epidemic of coronavirus, but today India is one of the fastest-growing large economies of the world," he added.

151.title: Rashmika to star opposite Tiger Shroff in his untitled next: Report
151.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna will reportedly star opposite Tiger Shroff in his untitled next. "The team will be shooting in India as well as internationally," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will be directed by Shashank Khaitan and produced by Karan Johar. It is expected to go on floors in the month of September, reports added.

152.title: BJP bags 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal Pradesh
152.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won 102 out of 130 seats unopposed in the gram panchayat elections in Arunachal Pradesh. Other 14 seats were bagged by Congress, National People's Party (NPP) and independent candidates. Chief Minister Pema Khandu thanked all BJP supporters on Twitter and said, "Congratulations and thanks to all karyakartas, supporters and sympathisers."

153.title: In a first, Gujarat to host 36th National Games in Sept: CM Patel
153.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel announced that they will be hosting the National Games for the first time this year. The western state will host the 36th edition between September 27 and October 10, CM Patel said. "Gujarat has been equipped with world-class sports infrastructure...[we] will leave no stone unturned to make the National Games best till date," he tweeted.

154.title: New players expressing themselves well; bench strength getting better: Pandya
154.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that the new players who are coming into the Indian team are "expressing themselves really well". "The bench strength is getting better. The culture is changing," Pandya said. "They (management) have given us the freedom...Even if we get out playing a stroke, we never get a vibe after coming back," Pandya added.

155.title: CoinSwitch appoints ex-Flipkart exec as crypto Head of Engineering
155.article_body: CoinSwitch has appointed former Flipkart executive Sudheer Tumuluru as the crypto Head of Engineering. The news comes a day after CoinSwitch said three of its top executives and a senior blockchain engineer had left the company to start their own Web3 venture. Tumuluru, who served as a Director of Engineering at Flipkart, was also VP of Engineering at Myntra.

156.title: Former PayPal executive Jasmine Lee appointed Binance.US CFO
156.article_body: Binance.US, the US partner of world's largest crypto exchange Binance, appointed ex-PayPal Holdings executive Jasmine Lee as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) on Thursday. Lee has replaced interim CFO Eric Segal, who recently left the company after holding the role since October 2021. Jasmine had previously served as CFO and Chief Operating Officer for the Consumer Product Group at PayPal.

157.title: Deepak Hooda's performance will put pressure on Kohli: Wasim Jaffer
157.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said India batter Deepak Hooda's performance in the first T20I against England will "put pressure" on Virat Kohli when he returns to the team for the second T20I. Hooda scored 33 runs off 17 balls in the first T20I. Hooda recently became the fourth Indian to smash a ton in the history of men's T20Is.

158.title: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal's sacrificial goat gets stolen from his Lahore residence
158.article_body: One of the sacrificial goats Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal had bought for Eid ul Adha was stolen from outside his house in Lahore. Akmal’s father said that they had bought six goats to sacrifice a day ago and tied them outside their home. The theft reportedly took place at around 3 am.

159.title: Twitter fires 30% staff from its talent acquisition team amid deal with Musk
159.article_body: Months after announcing a hiring freeze, Twitter on Friday fired 30% of its talent acquisition team amid its $44 billion acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk. A Twitter spokesperson confirmed these layoffs but did not share the exact number of affected employees. While these employees will receive severance packages, the company will "reprioritise" the remaining recruitment staff.

160.title: Karan Kundrra buys Jeep Wrangler Rubicon worth ₹60.35 lakh
160.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra has bought a Jeep Wrangler Rubicon which is worth around ₹60.35 lakh. The actor recently shared the news with his fans and followers on his official YouTube channel. According to reports, Karan has one Range Rover Sport SVR, a Mini Cooper and an older generation of Ford Endeavour and a Ducati Diavel bike.

161.title: It didn't have the same control we saw for GT: Swann on Hardik's 51(33)
161.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said Hardik Pandya's 51 off 33 balls in the first T20I against England didn't have the same control as visible in his knocks for GT during IPL 2022. Swann added this was because Hardik was taking his time while batting for GT. Hardik's 51 comprised six fours, a six. He had a strike rate of 154.54.

162.title: 1 student dies, 13 injured as tree uproots and falls on them at Chandigarh school
162.article_body: At least one student died and 13 got injured after a tree got uprooted and fell on them at Carmel Convent School in Chandigarh's Sector 9. Those injured were shifted to a hospital, ANI reported. Reportedly, the condition of a student and teacher is critical. The tree that fell was around 70 feet tall and 250 years old, reports added.

163.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
163.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power outages today and tomorrow as BESCOM is carrying out maintenance and repair works. Most of these works will be done between 10 am and 5 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Navilu Nagar, Vinayaka Nagar etc. While the areas that will face power cuts tomorrow include Indira Nagar, KR Road etc.

164.title: India responds after China's statement on PM Modi's birthday greetings to Dalai Lama
164.article_body: India has responded after China's statement on PM Narendra Modi's birthday greetings to Dalai Lama. "It is a consistent policy of the government of India to treat His Holiness Dalai Lama as an honoured guest in India," government said. "His Holiness is accorded all due courtesies and freedom to conduct his religious and spiritual activities in India," the government added.

165.title: Wanted to make a movie like Jumanji, Indiana Jones: Sudeepa on Vikrant Rona
165.article_body: Kichcha Sudeepa, while speaking about his upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', said, "I insisted...we shoot everything indoor. We get the aesthetics right. No real locations." "I started thinking and feeling like we need to make a film like 'Jumanji'. We should have sets like 'Tarzan', 'Indiana Jones'. And nothing real-time can support you on that. You have to create," he added.

166.title: Crypto firm Celsius accused of fraud weeks after it froze users' assets
166.article_body: Celsius Network, which froze assets last month, used customer funds to rig the price of its crypto token and failed to hedge risk, a former money manager for the company has said. Celsius allegedly ran a Ponzi scheme to benefit itself through "gross mismanagement of customer deposits". The platform paused all transfers and withdrawals in June citing ''extreme market conditions''.

167.title: Heavy rainfall causes rock sliding in Pune; road cleared in 30 mins
167.article_body: A rock sliding incident took place near old Katraj tunnel in Pune as the city witnessed heavy rainfall. The road was cleared within 30 minutes with the help of a JCB machine, officials said. "There was a fear of the rock hitting vehicles...however, there were no casualties. Such an incident has occurred after two-three years," Dhankawadi Assistant Municipal Commissioner said.

168.title: No coercive action against TV anchor Ranjan: SC in Rahul Gandhi video case
168.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday ordered "no coercive action of arrest" against TV anchor Rohit Ranjan in connection to multiple FIRs being filed against him after a misleading clip about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was aired on his show. Ranjan approached the top court seeking an urgent hearing on his plea for protection from coercive action for the alleged offence.

169.title: 3 friends jump into canal to prove friendship in Faridabad; 1 rescued
169.article_body: Three drunk friends reportedly jumped into the Agra canal in Faridabad to prove their commitment to each other, police said on Thursday. While one of them has been rescued, other two are still missing. "All three of us jumped into canal one by one to prove how far we could go to prove our friendship," the rescued person told police.

170.title: Ons Jabeur becomes 1st Arab player, African woman to enter Grand Slam final
170.article_body: Women's tennis player Ons Jabeur has become the first Arab and Tunisian as well as the first African woman to enter a Grand Slam final after reaching the final of Wimbledon 2022. Jabeur defeated Tatjana Maria 6-2, 3-6, 6-1 in the semi-final. "I want to...inspire many more generations...We never believed...that we can do it, but...I'm trying to show...them," she said.

171.title: Bodies of 3 youths, aged 14-20, recovered from Yamuna in Delhi
171.article_body: Bodies of three youths, aged between 14 and 20 years, were retrieved from the Yamuna river in Burari, Delhi. The youths had come from Loni to take a bath before they drowned in the river, police said. The search operation is still underway as the body of the fourth youth is yet to be recovered, police added.

172.title: 18 held in Karnataka's Kerur after 3 stabbed during clashes, shops burnt
172.article_body: Karnataka's Bagalkote Police arrested 18 persons and registered four FIRs after three persons were stabbed in Kerur and shops were burnt. Clashes broke out between two groups after members of each side accused the other of harassing women. A Hindutva group leader accused Muslim men of eve-teasing a Hindu girl, police said. Large gatherings are banned till Friday in Kerur.

173.title: Johnny Depp donates earnings from NFT sale to charity associated with Amber Heard
173.article_body: Johnny Depp has donated the proceeds from an NFT sale to four charities, including the Children's Hospital Los Angeles, which has ties to Amber Heard. Depp's Never Fear Truth NFT (non-fungible token) platform announced that it had raised nearly $800,000. After the announcement, fans praised The Pirates of the Caribbean actor for his "never-ending kindness".

174.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹1 lakh while trying to claim birthday gift
174.article_body: An air hostess from Mumbai was cheated of ₹1 lakh while trying to claim her birthday gift from an online shopping company. According to police, the complainant had received a link by the courier service to claim her parcel. She then shared her bank details on the link following which ₹1 lakh was transferred from her account, police added.

175.title: SC grants interim bail to Alt News' Zubair in case against him in UP's Sitapur
175.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday granted interim bail to Alt News Co-founder Mohammad Zubair in the case registered against him in Sitapur, Uttar Pradesh. The court also issued notice to the UP police on Zubair's plea challenging Allahabad High Court order. The Allahabad High Court had dismissed petition moved by Zubair challenging FIR registered against him for a tweet.
