176.title: In bid to implicate his grandfather, man kills 6-yr-old child in UP
176.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly murdered a six-year-old child in a bid to implicate his own grandfather who had stopped the accused from playing PUBG. During interrogation, the accused reportedly confessed that he kidnapped the child, sealed his lips with adhesive and strangled him to death. The deceased used to take tuition from the accused's grandfather.

177.title: Over 50% road accidents in last 6 months involved bikers: Cyberabad police
177.article_body: Nearly 58% of road accidents recorded over the last six months in Cyberabad involved those riding two-wheelers, Cyberabad Traffic Police said. Out of the 363 deaths reported since January 1 this year, 211 fatalities included those driving two-wheelers or riding pillion, the police added. Officials further noted that around 191 victims were riding the vehicle without a helmet.

178.title: Deeply shocked by attack on my friend Shinzo Abe: Manmohan Singh
178.article_body: Former PM Manmohan Singh on Friday reacted to former Japan PM Shinzo Abe being shot at during a speech in Nara city, saying, "Deeply shocked by the tragic attack on my friend [former Japan PM Abe]." "My prayers are with him and [his] family," Singh added. A 41-year-old man who reportedly shot Abe from behind has been arrested.

179.title: Outgoing US Secret Service Director to be Snap's security head
179.article_body: Snapchat-parent Snap has said that the outgoing US Secret Service Director James Murray will join the social media platform as its Chief Security Officer following his retirement from the service. Murray will start in his new role with Snap on August 1. He will be reporting directly to Chief Executive Officer Evan Spiegel.

180.title: Samantha in talks for Vicky's 'The Immortal Ashwatthama': Report
180.article_body: The makers of Vicky Kaushal starrer 'The Immortal Ashwatthama' have reportedly approached Samantha Ruth Prabhu for a role in the upcoming film. "Samantha has liked the world of Aditya (Dhar, director), however, the talks are still in a very advanced stage," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will go on the floors in 2023, the report said.

181.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla gets bail in corruption case
181.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to AAP leader and dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla. He was arrested on May 24 by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch following corruption allegations against him and was removed from the state Cabinet. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, Punjab Chief Minister's Office had said.

182.title: Happiness more important than any title: Nadal on pulling out of Wimbledon
182.article_body: Having pulled out of Wimbledon 2022 before his semi-final against Nick Kyrgios due to an abdominal tear, Rafael Nadal said, "The most important thing is happiness more than any title." "I can't risk that match and stay two, three months [out] of the competition," added Nadal. "I am very sad and [this has]...been a very tough [decision]," he stated.

183.title: Bairstow is on hot streak; overshadowing Root: Vaughan
183.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has said that English batter Jonny Bairstow is on a "hot streak". "Bairstow is currently going through the type of hot streak that batters only go through once or twice in their career...I experienced it in 2002-03," Vaughan said. "He [Bairstow] is overshadowing the greatest England batter [Joe Root] that I've ever seen," Vaughan added.

184.title: Twitter tests 'CoTweets' feature to let users co-author tweets
184.article_body: Twitter has started testing a feature called 'CoTweets' that will allow users to co-author tweets. The company said that a co-authored tweet, for which a user will have to send an invite to another, will appear on both authors' profiles with both usernames and profile pictures in the header. The test currently involves selected accounts from Canada, Korea and US.

185.title: Red alert in Mumbai, Thane as IMD predicts very heavy rainfall for 2 days
185.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert in Mumbai and adjoining areas for Friday and Saturday. It has predicted 'heavy to very heavy rainfall' in Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg for today. Moreover, an orange alert is in place till July 12, which may change depending upon the rainfall received during the next two days.

186.title: Disneyland's FB, Instagram accounts briefly hacked, racist posts made
186.article_body: Disneyland Resort's Facebook and Instagram accounts were briefly hacked on Thursday, the company said. As per the screenshots shared online, a person claiming to be a "super hacker" posted a number of racist and homophobic posts on these accounts. "We worked quickly to remove the reprehensible content, secure our accounts and our security teams are conducting an investigation," Disneyland said.

187.title: India reports 18,815 new COVID-19 cases, 38 deaths; active cases rise to 1,22,335
187.article_body: India has reported 18,815 COVID-19 cases, 15,899 recoveries and 38 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,930 cases and 35 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,22,335, while the death toll reached 5,25,343.

188.title: Ford, VW-backed self-driving startup Argo AI fires 150 employees
188.article_body: Argo AI, a US-based startup which works on self-driving vehicle technology, has fired around 150 employees. "We are making prudent adjustments to our business plan to best continue on a path for success," the company said on the job cuts. The startup, backed by Ford Motor Company and Volkswagen AG, has a global workforce of more than 2,000 employees.

189.title: The ultra-wealthy choose experts, now so can you: dezerv.
189.article_body: Indian HNI's have been investing through experts for generations as they understand the importance of financial expertise for growing their money, said wealthtech dezerv. This defined dezerv.'s mission: to help all working professionals access such experts who create & optimize high-performing investment portfolios. You can focus on what you do best while experts help secure your future, it added.

190.title: Steve Smith sells his 4-BHK mansion in Sydney for ₹67 crore
190.article_body: Australia cricketer Steve Smith has sold his mansion in Sydney for AU$12.38 million (over ₹67 crore), almost double what he paid for the property little more than two years ago. As many as four parties had registered to bid on the four-bedroom, three-bathroom house, with bidding getting opened with an offer of AU$11.5 million.

191.title: Mahindra's EV unit to raise $250 mn from UK's BII at $9.1 bn valuation
191.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra and British International Investment (BII) will each invest up to $250 million in a new EV subsidiary of Mahindra at a valuation of $9.1 billion. BII's investment will result in a 2.75% to 4.76% stake in the business. Mahindra's shares rose to as much as 5.4% to a record high on Friday.

192.title: Sara Ali Khan, Kartik Aaryan were dating each other, confirms Karan Johar
192.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has confirmed that actors Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan were dating each other. Karan stated that Sara mentioned Kartik's name on his show 'Koffee with Karan' and they later started dating each other. "It's fantastic that this couch has actually manifested so many relationships!" Karan Johar said about his show.

193.title: CBI files FIR against Chitra, ex-Mumbai Police chief for tapping phones of NSE officials
193.article_body: The CBI has filed an FIR against former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna for alleged phone tapping of NSE employees during 2009-2017. It said that Isec Securities Pvt Ltd, a company incorporated by Pandey in March 2001, conducted illegal surveillance of NSE employees on orders of NSE chiefs.

194.title: Odisha plans to give land titles to tribals under FRA by 2024
194.article_body: Odisha government is planning to give land titles to eligible tribals under Forest Rights Act (FRA) by 2024, ST and SC development department Principal Secretary Ranjana Chopra said. "[We are] also trying to create a digital footprint so that this ownership of land isn't lost in future," she added. "All tribals will be granted their rightful ownership," she further said.

195.title: Deeply distressed by the attack on my dear friend Shinzo Abe: PM Modi
195.article_body: After former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was shot during a speech in Nara city, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Deeply distressed by the attack on my dear friend Abe Shinzo. Our thoughts and prayers are with him, his family, and the people of Japan." Abe was in the city to support a candidate in this weekend's Upper House election.

196.title: Single-use plastic ban a step towards building a sustainable planet: Bhupender Yadav
196.article_body: Union Cabinet Minister for Environment Bhupender Yadav said that the ban on single-use plastics is a significant step towards building a sustainable planet. "PM Narendra Modi-led government believes that development should not come at the cost of the environment," he added. "We can eliminate single-use plastics from our daily lives with everyone's participation and combined efforts," Yadav stated.

197.title: Shinzo Abe critical, doctors working very hard to save him: Japan PM
197.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has said that former PM Shinzo Abe is in critical condition. "It is barbaric and malicious and it cannot be tolerated. We will do everything we can. At this moment, doctors are working very hard to save Mr Abe," Kishida added. Abe was shot by a man from behind during a speech in Nara city.

198.title: We were sloppy, need to work on it: Rohit on 6 catches dropped in 1st T20I
198.article_body: Talking about the six catches dropped by the Indian fielders in the first T20I against England, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We were sloppy in the field...Those catches should've been taken." "We'll look to work on it and come back stronger," added Rohit. Dinesh Karthik dropped three catches while Deepak Hooda, Suryakumar Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal dropped a catch apiece.

199.title: Woman arrested for running prostitution racket in Hyderabad
199.article_body: A woman was arrested for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Hyderabad's Jawaharnagar area on Thursday. The accused, identified as Sirigadi Aruna, roped in women from Andhra Pradesh on the pretext of providing a livelihood and forced them into prostitution. Aruna is already under trial for human trafficking. She has been reportedly involved in these crimes since 2019.

200.title: Priyanka to play Mindy Kaling's Punjabi cousin in upcoming H'wood rom-com
200.article_body: Priyanka Chopra will be seen playing the role of Mindy Kaling's Punjabi cousin in their upcoming Hollywood rom-com, which will revolve around a big fat Indian wedding. Mindy said Priyanka will play a Punjabi Indian from India in the film, while she'll play an Indian American Bengali woman from the East Coast. The project will mark their first collaboration together.

201.title: He swings the ball in all conditions: Buttler on Bhuvneshwar's 1/10
201.article_body: England's white-ball skipper Jos Buttler said Team India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar can swing the ball in all conditions, following his spell of 1/10 in the first T20I against England. "Certainly the ball swung longer than I can remember in a T20 game," added Buttler. Bhuvneshwar had an economy rate of 3.33 and dismissed Buttler for a golden duck.

202.title: Bangladeshi murder accused on run for 7 years arrested in Bengaluru
202.article_body: A Bangladeshi national, who was on the run after being accused of murdering a blogger in Sylhet in 2015, was arrested in Bengaluru, officials said on Thursday. The murder accused, identified as Faisal Ahmed, had illegally crossed into India and was working as a cab driver in Bengaluru, police said. The police added that Ahmed allegedly has links to Al-Qaeda.

203.title: It's going to be a tsunami at the box office: Johar on SRK's 'Pathaan'
203.article_body: Karan Johar, speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Pathaan', said, "When Pathaan...[comes], it's going to be a tsunami at box office." "Shah Rukh has kept people waiting...and the more they wait, the more they'll...give back in terms of love, to I believe the biggest star of our country," he added. 'Pathaan' is slated to release on January 25, 2023.

204.title: Ex-Sena MLA, 8 policemen booked for assaulting Dalit man in Pune
204.article_body: Former Shiv Sena MLA Mahadev Babar and eight police personnel have been booked for allegedly assaulting a Dalit man during a bandh last year in Pune. Babar and some others had reportedly forced the complainant to shut his sister's fish stall and thrashed him. Later, when the complainant went to Kondhwa police station, the accused police officers apparently beat him.

205.title: Extreme unemployment: Chidambaram on applications received under Agnipath
205.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said that "extreme unemployment situation" in the country was the reason behind the Indian Air Force (IAF) receiving 7.5 lakh applications under Agnipath scheme. "Wrong conclusion: the Agniveer scheme is popular among...youth," he tweeted, adding that the correct conclusion would be the unemployment, which is driving desperate youth to take any job.

206.title: Man who shot former Japan PM Shinzo Abe identified; pic of arrest surfaces
206.article_body: The man who shot former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been identified as 41-year-old Yamagami Tetsuya. Pictures of the attacker's arrest surfaced on social media. Abe was making a speech for an election campaign in Nara city when he was shot from behind by the attacker, local media said.

207.title: Rohit Sharma creates world record for most T20I wins in a row as captain
207.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has created a world record after India defeated England by 50 runs in the first T20I. Rohit has become the first captain in the history of men's T20I cricket to win 13 matches in a row. The previous record of 12 consecutive victories as captain was held jointly by Afghanistan's Asghar Afghan and Romania's Ramesh Satheesan.

208.title: UP man shares video threatening to behead Nupur Sharma, arrested
208.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly Police on Thursday arrested a man who allegedly threatened to behead suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad. This comes after a video of the accused issuing the threats was shared on social media. "We've arrested the accused for issuing threats online...trying to incite communal tensions...he was arrested from his house," police said.

209.title: My political & social tenure is not yet over: Naqvi after resignation
209.article_body: Senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, who resigned as Union Minority Affairs Minister recently, said his political journey is not yet over. "I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed, but my political and social tenure has not yet been completed," he said. "I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society," Naqvi added.

210.title: Huawei India sent ₹750 crore to parent firm in China to evade taxes: I-T Dept
210.article_body: The Income Tax Department has alleged that Huawei India transferred ₹750 crore to its parent company in China in the form of dividends to evade taxes. It further said that the company made these transfers in two years even as its revenues drastically fell in India. The I-T Department froze Huawei's bank accounts in February after raids at its premises.

211.title: IMD issues red alert for Goa; schools closed for 2 days for Classes 1-8
211.article_body: After India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert warning for Friday in Goa, the government directed schools to remain closed for Classes 1-8 on Friday and Saturday. IMD issued an orange alert for July 7, 9 and 10 and a red alert for July 8 in Goa. "Possibility of very heavy rainfall...for five days," IMD said on Thursday.

212.title: Ronaldo must be thinking 'When will Man Utd start making moves': Rio
212.article_body: Ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said his former team's forward Cristiano Ronaldo must be wondering about when the Red Devils will start making transfers. "Seeing Manchester City signing Erling Haaland...[and] Liverpool signing Darwin Núñez...he would be thinking 'They are jumping even further away,'" added Ferdinand. United finished sixth on the Premier League points table last season.

213.title: Trump was removed as director of his media group in June: Report
213.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump was removed as a director from the board of his media firm Trump Media & Technology Group last month, Reuters reported citing filings. The removal took place weeks before TMTG was served with subpoenas from federal authorities. The US SEC, which has been probing TMTG's deal with Digital World, sent TMTG a subpoena in June.

214.title: 4 friends lose ₹20 lakh, 2 cars, bike to fraudsters in Gurugram
214.article_body: Four friends were allegedly cheated of ₹20 lakh, two cars and a bike by three fraudsters after the latter promised to get them jobs at AIIMS, Delhi. The four victims, who are residents of Nai Basti in Gurugram's Sector-8, were even provided with fake joining letters, police said. The victims are Hitesh Rai, Vikram Chauhan, Ajay Kumar and Vijay Kumar.

215.title: Centre creating 'economic blockade' for West Bengal: CM Mamata Banerjee
215.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday claimed that the central government is creating an "economic blockade" for the state by not releasing funds for MGNREGA and other schemes. "UGC grants have also been stopped and is causing trouble to PhD students doing research," Mamata added. She was speaking at a programme held to distribute students' credit cards in Kolkata.

216.title: Mobile thief forgets to switch off stolen handset in Mumbai; arrested
216.article_body: A 20-year-old mobile thief from Mumbai's Borivali West was arrested after he allegedly forgot to switch off a stolen handset before burying it in his chawl's backyard. Police tracked the accused, who used to steal mobile phones and later sell them on the black market, using mobile tower location. He had successfully stayed off the police radar for four years.

217.title: Govt didn't give proper reasons: Twitter as it challenges 39 blocking orders by IT Min
217.article_body: Twitter is challenging around 39 blocking orders issued by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology in the Karnataka High Court. Arguing that the government didn’t provide "proper reasons" for issuing the blocking orders and has been "increasingly" doing so, it said that between February 2021 and 2022, it was asked to take down 1,474 accounts and 175 tweets.

218.title: Video shows the moment former Japan PM Abe was shot at during speech
218.article_body: A video showing the moment former Japan PM Shinzo Abe was shot during a speech in the city of Nara has surfaced on social media. Police have arrested a man on suspicion of attempted murder and retrieved a gun, local media reported. Abe has been taken to a hospital and his condition remains unknown.

219.title: James Caan, best known for playing Sonny Corleone in 'The Godfather', dies at 82
219.article_body: American actor James Caan, known for playing Sonny Corleone in 'The Godfather', died aged 82. "Jimmy was one of the greatest. Not only was he one of the best actors our business has ever seen, he was funny, loyal, caring and beloved," his manager Matt DelPiano said. Caan, who also appeared in 'Misery', 'Thief' and 'Rollerball', was an Oscar nominee.

220.title: 9-month-old dies due to COVID-19 in Mumbai, youngest this year in city
220.article_body: After a gap of 22 days, two COVID-19 deaths were reported in Mumbai on Thursday. One of these deaths was that of a nine-month-old baby with heart disease and down syndrome. This is reportedly the youngest death in the city so far this year. Mumbai has reported 28 deaths in the 0-9 age group ever since the coronavirus pandemic began.

221.title: 9 dead, 1 rescued alive after car washes away in river in Uttarakhand
221.article_body: At least nine persons died after a car got washed away in the Dhela river in Uttarakhand's Ramnagar amid a heavy flow of water due to rains on Friday morning, Kumaon Range DIG Nilesh Bharne said. About five persons are trapped and one girl has been rescued alive, he added. Efforts are on to identify all the dead, Bharne stated.

222.title: CoinSwitch CFO, Senior VP, 2 others quit firm to start Web3 venture
222.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CFO Sarmad Nazki, Chief Business Officer Sharan Nair, Senior VP Krishna Hegde and Yadunandan Batchu, a senior blockchain engineer, have quit the firm to start their own Web3 venture. "We...have not zeroed in on an idea for the startup yet," Nair said. "I'm happy to see Sharan, Sarmad and Krishna spread out," CoinSwitch CEO Ashish Singhal said.

223.title: 32 Sena corporators from Navi Mumbai meet Shinde, extend support
223.article_body: As many as 32 Shiv Sena corporators from Navi Mumbai met with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday and extended their support to him. This comes after 66 of the party's corporators from Thane joined Shinde's camp. "[Shinde] never declined anybody's phone call. Even if an ordinary party worker calls him up, he receives...call," the Navi Mumbai corporators said.

224.title: 76 traffic junctions in Noida being put under ITMS surveillance
224.article_body: Almost 76 traffic junctions in Noida have been put under intelligent traffic management system (ITMS) surveillance in order to identify traffic violators. The traffic police, which used ITMS on trial for the past two months, can issue e-challans with the help of ITMS. Notably, the traffic junctions include Okhla Bird Sanctuary Metro Station, Amrapali Chowk and Atta Chowk Gol Chakkar.

225.title: Twitter says it removes over 1 million spam accounts daily, Musk reacts
225.article_body: Twitter removes over 1 million spam accounts daily, said executives on Thursday amid a report that Tesla CEO Elon Musk may drop the $44 billion deal over fake accounts' data. Reacting to this, Dogecoin's Co-founder Billy Markus remarked, "How many new real accounts does it have per day I wonder," to which Musk replied, "That is indeed the real question."

226.title: Heavy rains, thunderstorms in Kerala for next 5 days; yellow alert issued
226.article_body: Kerala government has warned of heavy rains and thunderstorms for the next five days in the state. A yellow alert has been issued for Friday and Saturday in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam. "There are reports that the water level in the Kadalundi, Bharathapuzha, Shiriya, Karuvannur and Gayathri rivers of northern Kerala is rising," Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said.

227.title: Bhopal Police issues look out circular against 'Kaali' director
227.article_body: Bhopal Police issued a look out circular against 'Kaali' director Leena Manimekalai over her film's poster showing a woman dressed as the Hindu goddess smoking a cigarette. This comes after Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said he will write to the Centre to issue a look out circular against her. UP and Delhi Police earlier filed FIRs against Manimekalai.

228.title: Woman found dead at construction site in Mumbai, 2 suspects arrested
228.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was found dead at an under-construction site in Mumbai's Andheri on Wednesday. Police have arrested two suspects, both natives of West Bengal, in connection with the case. The woman had reportedly been dead for two days, however, the death came to light when the supervisor found her and the suspects to be missing from work, police said.

229.title: Actor Richard Gere attends Dalai Lama's 87th b'day celebration in Dharamshala
229.article_body: Hollywood actor Richard Gere attended Dalai Lama's 87th birthday celebration in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. "I was able to meet his Holiness Dalai Lama in Dharamshala 40 years ago, which clearly changed my life," Gere said. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur also joined the celebration through video conferencing.

230.title: GameStop fires CFO Recupero, laying off several employees: Report
230.article_body: Video game retailer GameStop has fired its Chief Financial Officer Mike Recupero, Reuters reported. Following the news, the shares of the firm fell 8% in extended trading. Axios, which first reported Recupero's exit, cited a memo and reported that the firm is laying off an undisclosed number of employees. Recupero will be replaced by Chief Accounting Officer Diana Saadeh-Jajeh.

231.title: Mysterious fireball spotted over New Zealand, explosions heard; pic surfaces
231.article_body: New Zealanders across the North Island reported a mysterious fireball and a huge flash of light streaking across the sky on Thursday afternoon. They also reported rumbling and crackling sounds. A plumber named Curtis Powell captured the phenomenon on his dashcam while driving. He called it a "once-in-a-lifetime" spectacle.

232.title: B'luru police arrest 1 drug smuggler, seize drugs worth ₹80 lakh
232.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch has arrested a man allegedly involved in drug smuggling in the KR Puram Police Station limits, Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) Raman Gupta said on Thursday. The police also seized prohibited drugs worth ₹80 lakh. Earlier, police had arrested two drug peddlers from Sanjay Nagar and seized drugs and two phones worth ₹3 lakh.

233.title: Musk's Twitter deal in 'jeopardy', he has 'stopped funding discussions': Report
233.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk may walk away from the $44 billion agreement to buy Twitter as he doesn’t believe he has enough information on the number of fake accounts on Twitter, as per a report. According to The Washington Post report, the deal is "in serious jeopardy" and Musk has "stopped engaging in certain discussions around funding" for it.

234.title: Haryana BJP's IT cell chief removed after his 2017 tweet against Islam resurfaces
234.article_body: The BJP on Thursday removed its Haryana IT cell incharge Arun Yadav amid growing calls for his arrest over a 2017 tweet against Islam. "With over 85,000 tweets seeking his arrest, it has become a big issue," a BJP leader said. However, no police complaint has been filed against Yadav yet.

235.title: 22-yr-old man arrested in Hyderabad for selling banned e-cigarettes
235.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force along with the Begumpet Police arrested a 22-year-old man for illegally selling e-cigarettes and seized material worth ₹2.5 lakh from him. According to police, the accused, identified as Chinmai Katari, is a resident of Rasoolpura, Begumpet. He used to procure the banned items from Mumbai and sell them via social media platforms, police added.

236.title: Former Japan PM Shinzo Abe shot at while giving speech
236.article_body: Former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been shot during a speech in the city of Nara, according to reports. Abe was reportedly attacked by a man from behind while he was delivering the speech on a street. Police said that they have captured the man and are questioning him, according to reports.

237.title: 45-year-old doctor rapes minor girl at his clinic in Pune; booked
237.article_body: A 45-year-old doctor was booked on Thursday for allegedly raping a minor girl, who's now aged 19,  at his clinic in Pune between November 2019 and December 2020. The accused also reportedly took the girl's nude pictures and threatened to make them viral if she told anyone. The girl had gone to the clinic to get treatment for spinal disease.

238.title: Maximum number of dangerous buildings in North Delhi: MCD survey
238.article_body: The maximum number of dangerous buildings in the national capital is in North Delhi, as per a Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) survey. In South Delhi, only one building was found to be in dangerous condition while none were found in East Delhi. At least 112 dangerous buildings were found in the City Sadar Paharganj zone as of July 1.

239.title: Tesla crash that killed pedestrian under special probe in US
239.article_body: The US NHTSA has opened a special probe into a Tesla crash that killed a pedestrian in California. The crash involved a 2018 Tesla Model 3, suspected of being driven using the advanced driver assistance system. On June 7, a Tesla car reportedly went airborne and struck and killed a woman. A 39-year-old man was reportedly charged with vehicular manslaughter.

240.title: 35% of Mumbai population lives near chronic flooding hotspots: Data
240.article_body: Over 35% of Mumbai's population is estimated to be living within 250 metres of known chronic flooding hotspots, an analysis by World Resources Institute (India) revealed. Furthermore, it was revealed that less than half of the city's population has easy access to flood shelters during periods of heavy rain. Amid heavy rains, an orange alert has been issued for Mumbai.

241.title: India win 18th int'l match in a row under Rohit's captaincy, beat England in 1st T20I
241.article_body: India defeated England by 50 runs in the first T20I in Southampton. It's India's 18th victory in a row in international cricket under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma. All-rounder Hardik Pandya slammed his first-ever T20I fifty to help India put up a total of 198/8. He also took four wickets as England were bowled out for 148 in 19.3 overs.

242.title: India qualify for cross-over round in women's hockey WC despite 3-4 defeat against NZ
242.article_body: India qualified for the cross-over round despite losing 3-4 against New Zealand in their last Pool B match in women's hockey World Cup 2022. New Zealand topped the group and directly qualified for the quarter-finals. Meanwhile, India will face Spain or South Korea in cross-over round on Sunday. India will qualify for the quarter-finals if they win the cross-over round.

243.title: Nadal withdraws from Wimbledon semi-final due to abdominal tear, Kyrgios reaches final
243.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from Wimbledon 2022 due to an abdominal tear. Nadal was due to face Nick Kyrgios in men's singles semi-final on Friday. With Nadal withdrawing from the tournament, Kyrgios has received a walkover into the final. It will be the first time Kyrgios will be featuring in a Grand Slam final.

244.title: It's raining discounts up to 60% off at Grand Fashion Sale: Pantaloons
244.article_body: Pantaloons has revealed that its Grand Fashion Sale has grabbed all the eyeballs in the town and is here for you to shop until you drop. Kurtas, tops, jeans and joggers - why to choose one when you can have them all, said the brand, adding that customers can avail discounts up to 60% off on all the trendiest collections.

245.title: UK warship seized Iranian missiles headed for Yemen: Britain
245.article_body: A British Royal Navy vessel captured a consignment of Iranian missiles in the Gulf of Oman early in 2022, UK officials said on Thursday, suggesting Tehran's support for Yemen's Houthi rebels in the war-torn country. The seized equipment included surface-to-air missiles and engines for cruise missiles. Iran's mission to the United Nations rejected the UK's findings as "groundless".

246.title: 3 pvt banks allowed to provide services for defence procurement
246.article_body: The Centre has allowed three private-sector banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank, to provide financial services for overseas procurement by the Defence Ministry. Until now, only public-sector banks were allowed to offer these services. The banks may be allocated with LC business of ₹2,000 crore for one year, each on the capital and revenue side, the ministry said.

247.title: InsuranceDekho raises $100 million in latest funding round: Report
247.article_body: Insurance aggregator InsuranceDekho has raised $100 million in its latest funding round, YourStory reported. The Gurugram-headquartered startup was launched by automobile aggregator CarDekho in 2019 to make it easier for customers to compare and buy motor and health insurance. The platform has since expanded into other forms of insurance like life, term and retirement plans.

248.title: 10 lakh students out of schools in K'taka: Survey submitted in HC
248.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has been informed that more than 10 lakh students below the age of 14 have been out of schools and anganwadis in the state. A PIL was presented in the court on the basis of a survey. Over 15,000 students between the ages of 6-14 years were out of school and more than 10,000 never enrolled.

249.title: Brittney Griner pleads guilty to drug possession in Moscow trial
249.article_body: Jailed American basketball player Brittney Griner on Thursday pled guilty to possession and smuggling of drugs during her trial in Moscow but maintained no criminal intent. According to Russian media, Griner said she acted unintentionally as she had packed in haste. Griner was detained at the Moscow airport in February after cannabis oil was allegedly found in her luggage.

250.title: IIM Bangalore graduates' startup BuildNext raises $3.5 million
250.article_body: Proptech startup BuildNext, founded by IIM Bangalore graduates Gopikrishnan V and Finaz Naha, has raised $3.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The funding round was led by Madhumala Ventures, a subsidiary of Pidilite Industries and saw participation from Konglo Ventures, Vineet Kumar (CEO, Native) and Deep Gupta (FatEngine). The Kerala-based startup was incorporated in 2015.

251.title: Ethnic wear brand Libas looks to raise ₹150-200 cr for expansion
251.article_body: Ethnic wear brand Libas is looking to raise ₹150-200 crore through private equity for expansion of its offline presence. Sidhant Keshwani, CEO and Managing Director of Libas, said that they are in discussions with private equity firms and will announce a fund infusion soon. He further added that the company is targeting a revenue of ₹470-500 crore this fiscal.

252.title: RBI forex measures to impact flow positively: Economic Affairs Secy
252.article_body: Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth on Thursday said the measures announced by the RBI on Wednesday to enhance foreign exchange inflows will have a "positive" impact on flows. "In the overseas NDF (non-deliverable forwards) market, the rupee has appreciated," he stated. This comes after the rupee hit an all-time low of 79.37 against the US dollar on Tuesday.

253.title: 77% weekly increase in number of monkeypox cases: WHO
253.article_body: The World Health Organization on Thursday said there was a 77% weekly increase in the number of monkeypox cases worldwide, taking the total caseload to over 6,000 which includes three deaths. The increase in cases was reported mostly from Europe and Africa. The health agency said the disease is mainly found among men who have had sex with other men.

254.title: Stalin congratulates PT Usha, Ilaiyaraaja on Rajya Sabha nomination
254.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has extended greetings to athlete PT Usha and music icon Ilaiyaraaja on their Rajya Sabha nomination. "Congratulations to PT Usha on being nominated to the Council of States," Stalin tweeted. Stalin also congratulated the music maestro for his upcoming stint in the Rajya Sabha. Ilaiyaraaja thanked Stalin for the wishes.

255.title: Terrorist linked Al-Badr arrested in Jammu & Kashmir's Awantipora
255.article_body: A terrorist linked to outfit Al-Badr was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Awantipora by the police. Upon getting information, J&K police along with the Army and CRPF officials established a joint checkpoint in the area. The terrorist, identified as Aamir Ahmed Parray, was arrested during the check. A pistol and four pistol rounds were recovered from his possession.

256.title: Jamia Millia's offline classes to start from July 16
256.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia on Thursday said their offline classes will start from July 16, except for first semester/year students for whom classes will begin from August 1. The ongoing admission process will close on July 31. Examinations will be held from December 1 to 15 and the winter break will be from December 23 to January 1, 2023.

257.title: Climate tech startup Climes raises $1.2 mn from Sequoia, others
257.article_body: Climate tech startup Climes has raised $1.2 million in a funding round led by Sequoia Capital India, Kalaari Capital, Avaana Capital and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath. Climes will use the raised capital to integrate with different brands and enable a pathway for companies to become climate leaders. It'll also upgrade its tech stack to enable quick adoption of climate solutions.

258.title: Nykaa parent shares surge 5% after men's innerwear brand launch
258.article_body: The shares of Nykaa's parent company, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, surged around 5% on Thursday. On BSE, its stock hit an intraday high of ₹1,469.85. This comes after the company announced the launch of its first innerwear and athleisure brand for men called GLOOT. Nykaa Fashion said GLOOT is a "highly intelligent" tech creation that will provide anti-stain and anti-odour products.

259.title: Ukrainian Prez expresses 'sadness' at Boris Johnson's resignation
259.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday called Boris Johnson to express his "sadness" over the British leader's resignation as the PM of the UK. "Not only me, but...the entire Ukrainian society...is very sympathetic to you," he said. "We have no doubt that Great Britain's support will be preserved, but your personal leadership and charisma made it special," he added.

260.title: Map industrial activities for Gati Shakti scheme: FM to NITI Aayog
260.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday asked the NITI Aayog to prepare a report mapping all industrial activities, including defence corridors and pharma hubs, so that they can be incorporated under the PM Gati Shakti scheme. "I find many of them still lying loose and unconnected," she stated, while adding, "Mapping it up will probably give a better idea."

261.title: SoftBank's Rajeev Misra steps down from main roles to launch own fund
261.article_body: Rajeev Misra is stepping back from his main roles at SoftBank Group to launch his own venture fund, reports said. Misra will retain his role overseeing the first $100 billion Vision Fund but will cede his frontline role in managing the second Vision Fund. He's reportedly secured over $6 billion in backing for his fund, including from Middle East investors.

262.title: Meta builds new AI model which can translate 200 languages
262.article_body: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, announced that it has built a new AI model which can translate 200 different languages. The model, built under Meta's 'No Language Left Behind' project, aims to enable over 25 billion translations across the company's apps daily. This comes after Meta was accused of failing to moderate harmful content in some languages.

263.title: 24-yr-old biker dies after truck hits him in Thane
263.article_body: A 24-year-old biker was killed after a trailer truck hit him from behind in Bhiwandi, Thane, on Wednesday night. Police filed a case of death by negligence against the unidentified truck driver, who escaped the scene after the accident. The accused driver was allegedly speeding, an official said.

264.title: Rohit breaks Kohli's record, becomes fastest to reach 1,000 T20I runs as India captain
264.article_body: India skipper Rohit Sharma on Thursday broke ex-India captain Virat Kohli's record for being the fastest Indian batter to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket as captain. With his 24(14) against England in the first T20I, Rohit crossed 1,000 T20I runs in 29 innings as captain. Kohli had taken 30 T20I innings to reach the 1,000-run mark as captain.

265.title: India elected to UNESCO panel on Intangible Cultural Heritage
265.article_body: India has been elected to the Intergovernmental Committee of UNESCO's 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (ICH) for the 2022-2026 cycle, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy announced on Thursday. As the nation celebrates Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, India will be a part of two prominent Committees of UNESCO - ICH and World Heritage, he said.

266.title: KTR inaugurates Safran's electrical and power factory in Hyderabad
266.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated French aerospace major Safran's electrical and power factory in Hyderabad on Thursday. "For the first time the group has decided to venture...in India and we're glad that you found Hyderabad to be the best ecosystem for setting up your...factories," KTR said. Aircraft engine facility will be set up with a 36 million-euro investment.

267.title: Development isn't 'chamak-dhamak' but empowerment of poor: PM Modi
267.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed a gathering in Varanasi, stating that development doesn't mean "chamak-damak" (glitter) but rather empowerment of the poor and deprived communities. He added that the government is working on providing piped water access to every household and building pucca houses. PM's remarks came after he laid foundation stones of projects worth ₹1,774 crore at event.

268.title: Spain's Pamplona hosts 1st bull-running festival since 2019
268.article_body: The first bull run since 2019 took place on Thursday at the San Fermín festival in Spain's Pamplona. Several runners were stomped, trampled or shoved to the cobblestone pavement during the run. "The energy is awesome - this is the greatest party, the greatest thing I've ever seen in my life," a tourist from Hawaii said.

269.title: My focus wasn't COVID-19: Alia on staying with Neetu after Rishi Kapoor's death
269.article_body: Alia Bhatt recalled staying with Neetu Kapoor after Rishi Kapoor's demise in 2020. She said, "I remember...April, May, June, my focus was not...on COVID...because we, as a family, were dealing with Rishi uncle's passing away...So, that was like...bang in the middle of the pandemic." "Post that it was spending time with Ranbir's mum...so that we could...be around her," she added.

270.title: 96% of Portugal is experiencing drought
270.article_body: Portugal is experiencing one of its worst drought spells, with 96% of the country declared to be under "extreme" or "severe" drought conditions. The temperatures in some parts of the country are expected to touch 43°C over this weekend. Government bodies have readied emergency teams as a third of the country is at risk of forest fires, officials said.

271.title: Actor-politician Raj Babbar gets 2-yr jail term for assaulting a polling officer in 1996
271.article_body: A Lucknow court has sentenced actor and Congress leader Raj Babbar to two years in jail for assaulting a polling officer in 1996 while contesting from Samajwadi Party. Babbar was convicted for voluntarily causing hurt to deter a public servant from performing his duty and three other offences. The court has also imposed a fine of ₹8,500 on him.

272.title: 10-month-old gets Railways' compassionate appointment after parents die
272.article_body: The Railways has given a compassionate appointment to a 10-month-old girl after her parents died in an accident in Chhattisgarh, officials said. She can work for Railways after turning 18 years of age. The girl's father, Rajendra Kumar, worked as an assistant at a railway yard in Bhilai. He, along with his wife, was killed in an accident in June.

273.title: Licences of country liquor suppliers extended in Delhi
273.article_body: Delhi government has extended the licences of country liquor suppliers by a month, as per an official notification. The licence-holders have been asked to pay pro-rata license fee for one month. While the Excise Policy of 2022-23 was approved by the Delhi government on May 5, it is yet to be approved by the Lieutenant Governor.

274.title: Police book man for stabbing food cart vendor in the neck in Guj
274.article_body: Police have booked a man who allegedly stabbed a food cart vendor multiple times in the neck for refusing to serve bread-omelette in Gujarat's Visnagar. As per the police, the accused Bhavik Patel approached food-cart vendor Nagjibhai Baldevbhai and attacked him when Nagjibhai said he ran out of bread. The Police have lodged a case under IPC section 307.

275.title: Sikhs, Hindus donate to family of Kabul gurdwara attack victim
275.article_body: Minority Afghan Sikhs and Hindus have donated 1 lakh afghani (around ₹90,000) to the relatives of the Muslim security guard who died in the terror attack on a gurdwara in Kabul last month. In the June 18 terror attack, two persons were shot dead. The Taliban government released 11 lakh afghani (₹9.72 lakh) for each of the deceased.

276.title: Federal Bank appoints MVS Murthy as its 1st Chief Marketing Officer
276.article_body: Federal Bank has appointed MVS Murthy as its first Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). Prior to being appointed at Federal Bank, Murthy was heading marketing, digital and corporate communication at TATA AMC. "We're happy to welcome MVS to the Federal family...I'm certain his vast experience will strengthen our brand positioning," said Federal Bank Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) Ajith Kumar KK.

277.title: Cong has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions: Rijiju
277.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised Congress and said the party has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions from the beginning. "Don't forget that people of India are not servants of anyone," Rijiju tweeted. Rijiju's comment comes a day after Congress' Abhishek Singhvi accused the BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges.

278.title: BSF nabs 4 Pakistani fishermen from creek area in Gujarat's Kutch
278.article_body: A BSF patrol on Thursday caught four Pakistani fishermen and seized their 10 boats off the coast of Kutch in Gujarat along the India-Pakistan maritime border, a force spokesperson said. Nothing suspicious was recovered from the boats, the spokesperson said, adding that fishermen were trying to sneak "into Indian territory" through one of the water channels of 'Harami Nalla' creek.

279.title: Delhi reports 579 new COVID-19 cases and 1 death in last 24 hours
279.article_body: Delhi reported 579 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the health department said on Thursday. The national capital also reported one COVID-19-related death, while 688 people recovered from the virus in the last 24 hours. Delhi's positivity rate now stands at 3.46% and there are currently 2,480 active coronavirus patients in the city.

280.title: Court sends 7 accused in Amravati chemist's killing to NIA custody
280.article_body: A special court in Mumbai on Thursday remanded seven persons arrested in connection with the killing of an Amravati-based chemist in the custody of National Investigation Agency (NIA) till July 15. Umesh Kolhe was stabbed to death after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Kolhe was on his way home when he was attacked.

281.title: 18-yr-old medical aspirant kills self in TN after finding NEET too hard
281.article_body: An 18-year-old boy preparing for National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET) allegedly died by suicide after finding the exam too hard. The boy, who completed Class 12 last year, failed the exam in his previous attempt. Police said they found a note in his room that stated that he tried his best but felt he wouldn't be able to score enough marks.

282.title: India's playing XI for first T20I against England announced
282.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against England in the first T20I at The Rose Bowl in Southampton. Rohit and Ishan Kishan will open the batting for India. India's playing XI also includes Deepak Hooda, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya. Meanwhile, Arshdeep Singh is making his India debut today.

283.title: Curbing global warming can cut Indian fossil fuel revenues: Report
283.article_body: In its efforts to limit global warming to 1.5 °C, India's fossil fuel revenues can drop around 65% of the 2019 levels by 2050, a report by the International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) said. Revenues from coal production can fall 15%, it added. India's fossil fuel revenues were $92.9 billion in 2019, accounting for 18% of total government revenues.

284.title: Arshdeep becomes India's 99th T20I cricketer, pics from cap presentation ceremony surface
284.article_body: Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh has become the 99th cricketer to represent India in T20I cricket. The 23-year-old received his debut cap from captain Rohit Sharma, with pictures from the cap presentation ceremony surfacing online. Arshdeep has played 49 T20 matches so far, taking 52 wickets. He represents Punjab in domestic cricket and Punjab Kings in IPL.

285.title: IndiGo hikes pilot, crew salaries after reported mass leave on Air India hiring day
285.article_body: IndiGo has hiked the salaries of its pilots and cabin crew by a further 8%, days after reports said that the airline's staff took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. The airline will also reinstate layover and deadhead allowances for pilots and crew from July 31. Crew unavailability had caused delays for hundreds of IndiGo flights recently.

286.title: Pankaj to play Atal Bihari Vajpayee in former Prime Minister's biopic: Reports
286.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi will reportedly play former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee in the film titled Main Rahoon Ya Na Rahoon, Yeh Desh Rehna Chahiye, Atal. It is an adaptation of Ullekh NP’s book The Untold Vajpayee: Politician and Paradox. Reportedly, the film on Atal Bihari Vajpayee will be produced by Vinod Bhanushali, Sandeep Singh, Kamlesh Bhanushali and Vishal Gurnani.

287.title: Centre releases ₹324 crore from SDRF for Assam flood relief aid
287.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday thanked PM Narendra Modi for releasing ₹324.40 crore from State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) in advance, stating that the amount would benefit the state. Over 170 people have died in the state due to torrential rains. Notably, Assam and Meghalaya recorded the highest June rainfall since 1966, IMD said.

288.title: Orange alert issued for Himachal, heavy rain likely in next 2 days
288.article_body: IMD has issued an orange weather alert for the next two days in Himachal Pradesh. "Heavy-very heavy rain with thunderstorm and lightning is likely to take place on Friday and Saturday...causing flash floods and triggering landslides," Shimla MeT centre Director Surender Paul said. Reportedly, 49 people died in rain-related mishaps in Himachal since the onset of monsoon on June 29.

289.title: My romance with Ranbir started due to a faulty plane seat: Alia Bhatt
289.article_body: In her appearance on Koffee With Karan season 7, Alia Bhatt revealed how the romance started between her and Ranbir due to a faulty plane seat. "[Ranbir]...was supposed to sit next to me...But...something got stuck on his seat," she added. "I was like, 'Why is this happening, why is my dream getting shattered?' But later...he came back," Alia said.

290.title: Tricolour to be hoisted at every house in Haryana from August 11-17
290.article_body: The Haryana government has launched a campaign to ensure that each house in Haryana should have the national flag hoisted from August 11-17. "This is a national festival and all the citizens of the country are fortunate that they are getting the auspicious opportunity to hoist the tricolour at their homes," said Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal.

291.title: Didn’t ask for info on those giving beheading calls against Hindus: NIA
291.article_body: The NIA on Thursday denied having asked people to inform it about anyone giving 'beheading' calls against Hindus in connection with the controversial remarks made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "Such messages are totally fake and malicious and are part of a mischievous design to mislead the public," NIA said in a statement.

292.title: Our missile strike killed Ukrainian troops on Snake Island: Russia
292.article_body: Russian Defence Ministry has said that its warplane struck and killed an unspecified number of Ukrainian troops on Snake Island in the Black Sea on Thursday. The troops had landed there to raise Ukraine's flag. Ukraine said earlier that its military forced Russia to retreat from Snake Island, while Russia claims it pulled out from the territory as "goodwill gesture".

293.title: China's Xiaomi produces first smartphones in Vietnam
293.article_body: China's Xiaomi Corporation on Thursday said that it has produced its first batch of smartphones in Vietnam. The smartphones were produced in Thai Nguyen in a factory operated by Xiaomi's partner DBG Technology. The devices have been sent to a Vietnamese distributor, Xiaomi said, adding that it would soon export smartphones to other Southeast Asian markets, including Malaysia and Thailand.

294.title: Unhelpful: India as it responds to Germany's comments on Mohammed Zubair's arrest
294.article_body: The Centre reacted to Germany's remarks on Mohammed Zubair's arrest and said, "This is our internal matter...Any comment on it is unhelpful. It's not right." "Matter is before the court. Our legal system is independent," it added. "India describes itself as the world's largest democracy. So one can expect democratic values like freedom of expression," Germany Foreign Ministry had said.

295.title: Facebook asks US court for FTC merger papers amid antitrust lawsuit
295.article_body: Meta's Facebook has asked an American court for eight documents created by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to review the company's purchases of Instagram and WhatsApp. This comes amid FTC's antitrust lawsuit against Facebook. Facebook claimed the documents would reveal that FTC had earlier determined that the acquisitions were unlikely to lessen competition or harm consumers.

296.title: Tender for 200 4th-generation Vande Bharat trains by Aug: Report
296.article_body: Indian Railways is in the final stages of readying a tender to manufacture the fourth-generation Vande Bharat trains, a senior official told Moneycontrol. They said, "The bidding documents for the fourth generation of 200 Vande Bharat trains have been finalised...We're planning to float the tender by August." India plans to manufacture 400 Vande Bharat trains in the next three years.

297.title: Nitin Gadkari awarded honorary degree of Doctor of Science in Maha
297.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari was conferred the honorary degree of Doctor of Science by Dr Panjabrao Deshmukh Krishi Vidyapeeth in Maharashtra's Akola. Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari awarded the degree to the Gadkari. Former Vice Chancellor Dr Motilal Madan, deans of faculty, professors, teachers and graduating students were present on the occasion.

298.title: Global economic outlook has darkened, can't rule out recession: IMF
298.article_body: IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva has said the outlook for the global economy has "darkened significantly" since April and the possibility of a global recession next year can't be ruled out. "We're in very choppy waters," she added, citing a more universal spread of inflation and increased interest rate hikes. IMF would soon further downgrade its 2022 growth forecast, she added.

299.title: Mumbai beaches to open only from 6-10 am during red, orange alerts for rainfall
299.article_body: Beaches in Mumbai will open for the general public only from 6 am to 10 am during the period of red and orange alerts issued by IMD, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. The decision has been taken in view of drowning incidents on various beaches in the city this year. People should be informed about it immediately, BMC added.

300.title: Dalai Lama is India's guest: MEA on reaction to PM's b'day greeting
300.article_body: After China criticised PM Narendra Modi for greeting Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday on Wednesday, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said that India treats the Tibetan spiritual leader as an honoured guest. The Chinese Foreign Ministry had said that India should fully recognise the separatist nature of Dalai Lama and stop interfering in China's internal affairs.

301.title: Rajnath Singh to brief parliamentary panel on Agnipath scheme on July 11
301.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will brief the members of the Parliamentary Consultative Committee on Defence on various aspects of the Agnipath scheme on July 11. The committee comprises MPs from ruling as well as opposition parties. The Defence Secretary, three Service Chiefs and other senior officials of the Defence Ministry are likely to be present in the meeting.

302.title: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal's romance began on 'Koffee With...': Karan
302.article_body: Karan Johar revealed it was on his show 'Koffee With Karan', where Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif's romance began. In an interview with a news portal, Karan revealed that he "loved" that the "VicKat" romance started on his couch. "I love...Vicky, Katrina's romance. I love...it came out of nowhere, it was beautiful and it started on this couch," Karan said.

303.title: What is the 'Pennywise' malware that uses YouTube videos to steal crypto?
303.article_body: Cyber intelligence company Cyble has warned of an "emerging threat" from a crypto-stealing malware called 'Pennywise' which may potentially spread through YouTube. Fraudsters are reportedly marketing 'Pennywise' as a free Bitcoin mining software and it can target 30 crypto wallets and browser extensions. More than 80 YouTube videos have been found that may expose users to potential hacks.

304.title: Afghan soil won't be used for attacks on other countries: Taliban
304.article_body: Taliban leader Hibatullah Akhundzada said on Wednesday that no country will be allowed to use Afghan soil to target other countries. Akhundzada also added that other nations should refrain from meddling in Afghanistan's internal affairs. "We want...strong diplomatic, economic and political relations with the whole world, including the US, within the framework of mutual...commitment," he added.

305.title: TMC delegation meets Governor over Dilip Ghosh's remarks against Mamata
305.article_body: An eight-member delegation of TMC, including party's leader Kunal Ghosh, met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday, seeking action against BJP leader Dilip Ghosh for his alleged derogatory comments against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. Governor Dhankhar has assured the TMC delegation that he will look into the matter. Ghosh had allegedly made some remarks about Banerjee's family during an event.

306.title: 16-yr-old accused of killing 17-yr-old TN boy to be tried as adult
306.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, accused of killing a 17-year-old schoolmate in Tamil Nadu, will be tried as an adult after his case was transferred to regular criminal court. Selva Surya died on April 30 after three students of a government school in Tirunelveli district attacked him with a stone. Of the three accused, only one will be tried as an adult.

307.title: 9 minor boys escape from observation home in Chhattisgarh
307.article_body: Nine inmates of an observation home for minor boys, one of whom was facing murder charge, in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada escaped on Thursday, officials said. "All nine inmates tied the caretaker, a home guard jawan and another officer with ropes," an official said. In all, 19 minor inmates accused of various crimes were lodged at the remand home, the official added.

308.title: S Korean group floats balloons toward N Korea with COVID relief items
308.article_body: A South Korean group said that it launched 20 balloons carrying COVID-19 relief items toward North Korea on Wednesday. The balloons carried 20,000 masks and tens of thousands of vitamin C and fever-reducing tablets to the isolated country amid a COVID-19 outbreak there. This comes after North Korea suggested that the outbreak began due to balloons flown from South Korea.

309.title: Rajnath Singh calls up Tejashwi to enquire about Lalu Yadav's health
309.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav and enquired about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is admitted at AIIMS in Delhi. "Praying for his speedy recovery," Rajnath Singh tweeted. Lalu Prasad Yadav was airlifted from Patna after he suffered a fracture due to a fall.

310.title: Doing my best to help underpopulation crisis: Musk after reports of welcoming twins
310.article_body: After reports claimed that Elon Musk welcomed twins with Neuralink top executive Shivon Zilis in November 2021, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "Doing my best to help the underpopulation crisis." "A collapsing birth rate is the biggest danger civilization faces by far," he added. Musk shares two children with singer Grimes and other five kids with his ex-wife Justine Wilson.

311.title: Precautions taken: Bommai after IMD predicts heavy rains in K'taka
311.article_body: After IMD predicted heavy rains in parts of Karnataka, CM Basavaraj Bommai said all necessary precautions have been taken after speaking to district deputy commissioners. "As per IMD, heavy rain is predicted in Kodagu, Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Uttara Kannada," he said, adding teams are prepared with equipment. Three people died after a landslide in Dakshina Kannada district on Wednesday.

312.title: Bhadohi MP Ramesh Chand Bind gets threat call, FIR registered
312.article_body: Police on Thursday said that BJP MP from Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, Ramesh Chand Bind, received an extortion call from an unidentified person who demanded ₹10 lakh from him. As per the complaint, the caller threatened to kill the MP and his family members if he failed to pay. An FIR has been lodged against the unidentified person, police said.

313.title: People think my decision to divorce Rajeev is wrong, it's for my daughter: Charu
313.article_body: Charu Asopa talked about her divorce from Rajeev Sen in her vlog and said people think her decision to divorce Rajeev is wrong, but she is taking the step after a lot of thinking. "I'm not taking the decision in a hurry or emotionally," she added. "I'm taking it consciously. It's not for me, it's for Ziana (daughter)," Charu said.

314.title: Russian forces taking operational pause in Ukraine: Foreign analysts
314.article_body: Russian forces may be taking an operational pause in Ukraine as part of efforts to reassemble its forces for a renewed assault, foreign analysts said. However, shelling by Russian forces in eastern Ukraine continued, according to Ukrainian officials. On Sunday, Russia said that it had taken control of Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of Lysychansk city.

315.title: India-focused PE, VC funds raised $14.1 bn in 2022: Report
315.article_body: In the first half of 2022, various India-focused private equity and venture capital funds have already raised $14.1 billion, as per a report by the Silicon Valley Bank. In the entirety of 2021, $4.2 billion was raised. As per the report, 48 funds have been launched in India taking the count from 28 last year to 76 now.

316.title: 16-yr-old accused of killing 17-yr-old TN boy to be tried as adult
316.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, accused of killing a 17-year-old schoolmate in Tamil Nadu, will be tried as an adult after his case was transferred to regular criminal court. Selva Surya died on April 30 after three students of a government school in Tirunelveli district attacked him with a stone. Of the three accused, only one will be tried as an adult.

317.title: School kids greet PM Modi with songs in UP's Varanasi, video surfaces
317.article_body: School children greeted Prime Minister Narendra Modi by singing songs in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Thursday. A video shared by BJP MP Anurag Thakur shows the Prime Minister sitting with a group of students who perform one by one. A boy played a drum in front of PM Modi, who praised him saying 'Shabash'.

318.title: 3 TMC workers killed by unidentified attackers in West Bengal
318.article_body: Three Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers were killed by unidentified attackers in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal on Thursday morning, police said. The deceased TMC workers, identified as Swapan Manjhi, Bhootnath Pramanik and Jantu Haldar, were on a bike when the attackers shot at them. The initial investigation suggests it seems to be a case of political violence.

319.title: Vivo India sent 50% of its income to China to avoid paying taxes: ED
319.article_body: The Indian arm of Chinese smartphone maker Vivo remitted 50% of its turnover to China to avoid paying taxes here, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. Around ₹62,476 crore of Vivo India's income was remitted to disclose huge losses in Indian incorporated companies, the agency said. Funds worth ₹465 crore in 119 banks linked to Vivo India entities have been seized.

320.title: Form welfare board for autorickshaw, taxi drivers: Sena MLA to Shinde
320.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Uday Samant on Thursday urged Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to form a board for the welfare of autorickshaw and taxi drivers in the state on the lines of Tamil Nadu. In a letter to Shinde, Samant said the move will benefit 8.32 lakh licensed autorickshaw and 90,000 taxi drivers and owners.

321.title: Kapil's show in New York postponed; Promoter says it's due to scheduling conflict
321.article_body: Kapil Sharma's show in New York has been postponed. The local promoter of the show shared on its website that the gig has been postponed due to a "scheduling conflict". The date of Kapil's New York show hasn't been announced yet but for audiences who've already booked their tickets for July 9, their ticket stands valid for the next date.

322.title: Madras HC dismisses pleas against ex-CM Edappadi Palaniswami
322.article_body: The Madras High Court on Thursday dismissed contempt applications against former Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for allegedly disregarding its June 23 orders. The pleas were dismissed as the Supreme Court stayed the June 23 orders, which restrained the AIADMK from passing resolutions on its leadership. Palaniswami's supporters are pushing for him to be the party's top leader.

323.title: Setu gets in-principle RBI nod to operate as an account aggregator
323.article_body: Agya Technology, a subsidiary of Pine Labs-owned fintech platform Setu, has received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India to operate as an account aggregator (AA). The approval came on July 4. This will allow Setu to launch its own AA platform. AAs are non-banking financial companies that enable sharing and access to data between financial institutions.

324.title: Over 6 million Sri Lankans facing food insecurity amid inflation: UN
324.article_body: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) has said that over six million Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity due to rising inflation amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Some 61% of households in the country are using coping strategies, such as cutting down their food expenses, WFP's assessment noted. Sri Lanka currently has an inflation rate of over 50%.

325.title: BJP chose Murmu as Prez candidate to gain tribal votes: Medha Patkar
325.article_body: Social activist Medha Patkar claimed that the BJP has fielded Droupadi Murmu as NDA's Presidential candidate only because tribal community forms a major part of the vote bank. "They cannot claim to be pro-Adivasi by not granting them forest rights and planning to hand over forests to the corporates," she said. The Presidential election will be held on July 18.

326.title: Goa's flood monitoring system hacked; hackers seek ransom in crypto
326.article_body: Goa's flood monitoring system was hacked by ransomware attackers who have demanded payment in cryptocurrency to release data, according to a police complaint filed by the state's water resources department. "The attack was carried out on June 21, 2022 midnight between 12am-2am. The integrity of the data has been altered making it impossible to back up...previous data," the complaint stated.

327.title: Who is Shivon Zilis, the executive with whom Elon Musk reportedly welcomed twins?
327.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed twins with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his brain-chip startup Neuralink, in November 2021, reports said. The 36-year-old, who grew up in Canada and attended Yale University, has worked as a Project-Director at Tesla. She's a founding member of the investment team at Bloomberg Beta and also featured in Forbes' 30 under 30 list.

328.title: Central Vista Avenue redevelopment project to be completed by July 18
328.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday said the redevelopment project of Central Vista Avenue from Vijay Chowk to India Gate, will be completed by July 18. He said some minor works are currently being carried out at one or two underpasses. Earlier, he said that Delhiites would be pleasantly surprised to see how the area is being totally transformed.

329.title: Haven't decided yet: TMC on taking disciplinary action against Moitra
329.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy on Thursday said the party hasn't taken any decision regarding taking disciplinary action against the party's MP Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "[TMC]...will make a decision at an appropriate time," he said, adding, "We don't approve of such comments." Notably, Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."

330.title: 3 Pune health officers caught for taking bribe from sonography centre
330.article_body: Maharashtra ACB has arrested three health department officers from Pune, including the district civil surgeon, for allegedly demanding a bribe for issuing a licence renewal certificate to a private sonography centre. According to the statement issued by ACB's DSP Shrihari Patil, the officers at the civil hospital in Aundh allegedly demanded ₹40,000 for issuing the renewal certificate.

331.title: Kashi best example of 'Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas': PM Modi
331.article_body: After laying foundation stone for projects worth around ₹1,800 crore in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Kashi is the best example of 'Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas'. "For us, development means poor, underprivileged, backward, tribals, women and old people feel empowered...we're ensuring work to get each poor a pucca house," PM Modi said.

332.title: 24-yr-old biker dies after speeding trailer rams into him in Thane
332.article_body: A 24-year-old biker died after a trailer mowed him down in Bhiwandi on Wednesday. "The deceased has been identified as Rahman Asrar Shah...He was going...towards Thane for personal work when the trailer came from behind and rammed into him...The driver who fled the spot was...speeding," police said. The victim, who was taken to a hospital, was declared dead before arrival.

333.title: Retd Kerala teacher builds temple that worships Indian Constitution
333.article_body: A Kerala-based 71-year-old retired social science teacher, Sivadasan Pillai, has built a temple where the main deity is Indian Constitution. "For me, my lord is Constitution and I worship it," Pillai said. The temple carries photos of Mahatma Gandhi, Swami Vivekananda, BR Ambedkar and Nobel Laureate Malala Yousafzai. The Preamble of the Constitution is etched on the temple's wall.

334.title: Producer Sandeep Singh threatened with 'Moosewala-like' death on FB, case filed
334.article_body: Film producer Sandeep Singh allegedly received a death threat on his Facebook account and filed a complaint at a local police station in Mumbai, police said. A case has been filed against an unknown person for threatening Singh with a death similar to singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in May. Actor Salman Khan was earlier similarly threatened.

335.title: Go and sit on a beach: Michael Vaughan while suggesting 3-month break to Virat Kohli
335.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said that Team India batter Virat Kohli needs a sabbatical. "Kohli looks like he needs three months away from cricket. Go and sit on a beach," Vaughan added. He further stated, "To have a three months break, is it going to affect him? No. Will it help him? Yes."

336.title: Tell your mate he isn't a thug: Tino to reporter over English media's treatment of Kohli
336.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Tino Best took to Twitter to defend Virat Kohli over English media criticising his aggression during Edgbaston Test. Reacting to a reporter's tweet over Kohli's celebration of Alex Lees' wicket, Best said, "Anyone who's bold, brown or black, y'all always got a damn problem with." He added, "Tell your mate...Virat isn't a thug...He's a modern day Icon...Simple."

337.title: Congrats on your first film as producer: Anushka to Alia for Darlings' teaser
337.article_body: Anushka Sharma congratulated Alia Bhatt on her film Darlings' teaser. "This looks lit," she wrote on Instagram. Besides, Anushka also sent wishes to Alia for donning the hat of a producer for the first time. "Congratulations, Alia...on your first film as...producer," she added. To this, Alia replied, "Thank you, my dearest Anushkaaa." Darlings is set to release on August 5.

338.title: 2 people given beheading threats in Rajasthan, police start probe
338.article_body: At least two men in Rajasthan's Bharatpur have allegedly received beheading threats by unknown persons in past 10 days, police said. An ambulance driver on Wednesday was approached by two unknown persons and handed over the threatening note, which was addressed to persons named Satish and Pramod, police said. This comes after a tailor was beheaded in Udaipur last month.

339.title: Man gets 5-year jail term for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyd
339.article_body: A court in Hyderabad on Thursday sentenced a man to five years in jail for sexually assaulting a minor girl in February 2017. The victim was returning to her home from school when the accused stopped her. The man had previously also attempted to molest the girl under Kanchanbagh police station limits.

340.title: Chhattisgarh announces bagless day on Saturdays; kids to play sports
340.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has announced bagless day in schools on Saturdays. The schools will organise yoga, sports and cultural activities on this day. An official said that the step has been introduced by the Department of School Education to make school education interesting and school principals will be asked to plan the activities for each Saturday of the month.

341.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air gets DGCA license to start commercial operations
341.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has received its Air Operator Certificate (AOC) from the DGCA, the aviation regulator said on Thursday. The airline will reportedly begin commercial flight operations later this month. Announcing the AOC's receipt, the airline said, "This is a significant milestone, enabling us to open our flights for sale."

342.title: PM launches, lays foundation stone of ₹1800-crore projects in Varanasi
342.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of multiple development projects worth over ₹1800 crore in UP's Varanasi. These projects include those relating to urban development, re-development of Namo Ghat, the heritage of Kashi, etc. During an event in Varanasi, PM Modi said, "Projects being launched in Varanasi will give momentum to the city's development journey."

343.title: India reacts to UK PM's resignation, says 'PM Modi & Johnson enjoyed close friendship'
343.article_body: After Boris Johnson resigned as the Prime Minister of the UK, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "PM Narendra Modi and PM Johnson enjoyed a close friendship." "These are internal developments, we are keeping a close watch...We have a multi-faceted partnership with the UK and we hope this will continue. We won't comment on leadership change," he added.

344.title: Uddhav still Sena chief, rebel group doesn't have recognition: MP
344.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Arvind Sawant on Thursday asserted that Uddhav Thackeray continues to be the Sena chief and stated that the rebel group doesn't have any recognition. "Even if two-thirds of the MLAs go, Uddhav Thackeray remains the Sena chief and according to law, only he is the one who can appoint a leader of the legislature party," he said.

345.title: JNU not against dhabas, but they've to follow rules & pay bills: VC
345.article_body: JNU Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said that the administration was not against the dhabas or canteens being there, but they have to follow the rules and pay their bills. "We are only trying to legalise. We are trying to say you pay the rent and electricity bill. They don't want to pay anything. They want everything free," she said.

346.title: Killings of 2 men from Manipur in Myanmar trigger protests
346.article_body: Protests erupted in Manipur's Moreh on Wednesday over the killing of two Tamil men from the state in a border town in Myanmar. The protesters also crossed the international border and torched a sentry post of Myanmar army. The bodies of P Mohan and M Iyarnar, who were shot dead, were found in Tamu on Tuesday.

347.title: Tata Projects, Power Grid executives arrested for bribery; ₹93 lakh cash seized
347.article_body: Senior executives of Power Grid Corporation of India and Tata Projects are among seven people arrested by CBI for alleged bribery to favour the private firm. Power Grid Executive Director BS Jha, Tata Projects Executive VP Deshraj Pathak and Assistant VP RN Singh have been arrested. Officials also recovered ₹93 lakh cash during a raid on Jha's Gurugram premises.

348.title: AAP shares pics from Bhagwant Mann and Gurpreet Kaur's wedding
348.article_body: AAP shared pictures from Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Dr Gurpreet Kaur's wedding on Thursday and wrote, "Punjab CM [Bhagwant Mann] & Dr. Gurpreet Kaur begin their married life. May God bless the Mann family with all the happiness in the world." Pictures showed the couple with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his family. Raghav Chadha also attending the wedding.

349.title: 3 tribals killed, 3 injured after being struck by lightning in MP
349.article_body: Three tribals were killed and three others suffered severe burn injuries after being struck by lightning in forest area in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur, a police official said on Thursday. The victims identified as 28-year-old Rambharat Adivasi, 27-year-old Dilip Adivasi and 20-year-old Mukesh Adivasi went for a picnic in the Ajnoi forest area when the lightning struck them, police added.
