350.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹3.7 lakh while selling furniture for ₹21,000
350.article_body: A 26-year-old Mumbai woman trying to sell furniture worth ₹21,000 online ended up losing ₹3.77 lakh to cyber fraud. According to the complainant, her company's manager asked her to collect the money from selling furniture for ₹21,000 on an online marketplace. The buyer, who turned out to be a cyber-fraudster, sent a QR code and made transactions worth ₹3.77 lakh.

351.title: TV set, desktop monitor stolen from Zilla Parishad school in Navi Mumbai
351.article_body: A television set and a desktop monitor were stolen from a Zilla Parishad school in Navi Mumbai's Taloja Panchanand area last week, police said. The thieves committed the crime after cutting the grill of the school building when no one was present there. The school authorities have registered a complaint at the Taloja police station.

352.title: B'luru Traffic Police announce deviations to ease traffic in Hebbal
352.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have come out with a fresh set of rules to decongest traffic on the Hebbal flyover and have blocked two crossover points in front of Manipal Hospital and Esteem Mall signal. "These changes have been proposed after studying the flow of vehicles at this junction, checking...data and factors causing traffic congestions," Bengaluru Traffic Police tweeted.

353.title: Ukraine to summon Turkish envoy after Russian ship with 'stolen grain' leaves
353.article_body: Ukraine has said that it will summon Turkey's ambassador to seek clarification after a Russian-flagged cargo ship allegedly carrying 'stolen' Ukrainian grain left a Turkish port. It is "unacceptable" that the Russian ship Zhibek Zholy was allowed to leave Karasu port despite "criminal evidence presented to the Turkish authorities", Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Oleg Nikolenko said.

354.title: Very proud of my govt's achievements: Boris as he resigns as UK PM
354.article_body: Boris Johnson, who on Thursday resigned as UK's PM, said he's "immensely proud" of his government's achievements, adding that he'll remain caretaker PM until new leader is chosen. "To...millions of people who voted for us in 2019...Thank you for that incredible mandate," he added. Johnson quit after over 50 MPs of his party resigned in protest against his leadership.

355.title: NITI Aayog ex-CEO Kant to replace Piyush Goyal as G20 Sherpa: Reports
355.article_body: Former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant will replace Union Minister Piyush Goyal as the Sherpa for the G20 Summit, reports said. Goyal reportedly requested Kant to take up the role because of his busy schedule. With G20 Presidency coming to India in December, a full-time Sherpa will reportedly be needed to devote a lot of time to meetings across India.

356.title: Aim behind NEP is to integrate education with modern ideas: PM Modi
356.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the three-day Akhil Bharatiya Shiksha Samagam in Varanasi. During the event, he said, "The foundational aim behind the National Education Policy is to bring education out from the limits of narrow thought-process and to integrate it with the modern ideas of...21st century." "NEP is paving the way for education in regional languages," he added.

357.title: Pune's SSPU invites startups to apply for ₹1-5 lakh funding, guidance
357.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University's (SSPU) Centre for Innovation, Incubation and Linkages is inviting early-stage startups to provide guidance and funding between ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh. Through its new pre-incubation platform, 'Power 2022,' the first five selected startups will be provided with the funds. The money will be given from the funds received from the Maharashtra State Innovation Society.

358.title: What are 'Nairobi flies', the skin-burning insects infecting students in Sikkim?
358.article_body: Over a hundred students of a Sikkim engineering college recently suffered severe skin infections due to 'Nairobi flies'. The small, beetle-like insects, which are orange and black in colour, thrive in areas with high rainfall. Health officials said these flies don't bite, but if disturbed while sitting on anyone's skin, they release potent acidic substance 'pederin' that causes burns.

359.title: Apologise to Delhi people for calling them thieves: AAP to LG
359.article_body: AAP on Thursday accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena of calling Delhi people "thieves" and demanded an apology for asking people to pay taxes to the civic body "honestly". "By the grace of God, you (LG) are sitting in a very responsible position. Delhi people only want cleanliness. There is no problem in paying taxes," said AAP's Durgesh Pathak.

360.title: 2-month-old crocodile rescued from a well in Thane
360.article_body: A baby crocodile, around two months old, was rescued from a well in Thane's Wagle Estate on Wednesday. It was rescued by Wildlife Welfare Association (WWA) and handed over to the forest department. "Well is not a natural habitat of crocodiles...someone might have brought it from a different place and thrown it in," an official of Thane forest department said.

361.title: I like to be a part of original stories: Ranbir on working in Shamshera
361.article_body: Speaking about working in Shamshera, Ranbir Kapoor said he likes to be a part of original stories and loves to have original music in his films. "Remixes...have their own place in the world and...audiences enjoy it. But, I like to be part of...original music," he added. "A lot of my success...has come through the music of my films," Ranbir said.

362.title: Man kills friend for not returning phone post call, held in Delhi
362.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a Nepali man for allegedly killing his friend for refusing to return his phone after making a call. According to DCP (central district) Shweta Chauhan, the accused killed the deceased after he refused to return his phone after making a phone call. The deceased also slapped the accused and called him a thief, Chauhan said.

363.title: 2 drug peddlers held in B'luru, 12 grams of MDMA crystals seized
363.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has arrested two drug peddlers from Sanjay Nagar, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police seized 12 grams of MDMA crystals, 27 grams of manufactured drug brown sugar and two mobile phones worth ₹3 lakh from the accused.

364.title: Finland passes law on more security on Russian border amid NATO bid
364.article_body: The Finnish parliament on Thursday voted to approve legislation that would allow barriers along the country's 1300-km long border with Russia. The legislation would also enable the closure of the border for refugees in case of exceptional circumstances. This comes days after NATO member countries officially signed off on the accession protocols for Finland and Sweden's induction into the bloc.

365.title: Iran detains several foreigners, a UK diplomat for spying
365.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards have detained several foreigners, including Britain's second most senior envoy in Tehran, for alleged acts of spying. "These spies were taking earth samples in Iran's central desert where the Revolutionary Guards' aerospace missile exercises were conducted," state TV stated. "Reports of the arrest of a British diplomat in Iran are...false," UK's foreign office said.

366.title: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigns
366.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has resigned after over 50 Members of Parliament resigned in protest at his leadership. This comes after UK's new Finance Minister asked Johnson to "go now", saying that the situation was "not sustainable and will only get worse". Johnson's supporters - including Priti Patel and Grant Shapps - had also urged him to step down.

367.title: 2 Punjab Police officers arrested for extorting money, possessing heroin
367.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Punjab Police arrested two police constables with 5 grams of heroin and seized ₹19,000 cash from them. The duo allegedly extorted money from a person, who possessed the contraband, in order to let him go. One of the accused is presently posted as  gunman with singer Mankirt Aulakh, STF officials said.

368.title: Rwanda, DR Congo agree to reduce tensions over rebel offensive
368.article_body: The Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda have agreed to de-escalate tensions sparked due to an offensive by M23 rebels in DRC's eastern borderlands, the Congolese presidency announced on Wednesday after a summit in Angola. The agreement included an immediate cessation of hostilities and the retreat of M23 fighters, it added. The DRC has accused Rwanda of backing M23.

369.title: ICMR-VCRC creates special female mosquitoes to control dengue, chikungunya
369.article_body: ICMR-Vector Control Research Centre (VCRC) has developed special female mosquitoes to control dengue and chikungunya. Female mosquitoes will mate with males and produce larvae that do not carry these viruses. Two colonies of Aedes aegypti, infected with wMel and wAlbB Wolbachia strains called Ae aegypti (Pud), have been developed to decrease spread of the diseases.

370.title: Home Minister Amit Shah virtually unveils 'Statue of Peace' in Srinagar
370.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah virtually unveiled the 'Statue of Peace' of Swamy Ramanujacharya located in a temple in the Sonwar region of Srinagar on Thursday. "This will be a message of peace in not only Kashmir but the whole country," Shah said. Saint Ramanujacharya, also known as Ramanuja, is revered as a Vedic philosopher and social reformer.

371.title: Eijaz Khan hospitalised due to typhoid & fever, shares glimpse from hospital
371.article_body: Actor Eijaz Khan has recently been hospitalised due to typhoid and fever. Taking to Instagram Story, he shared a picture of his hand. In the picture, Eijaz is seen resting on the hospital bed and several syringes have been attached to his hand.  Sharing the photo, he mentioned in scientific terms that he has been diagnosed with Typhoid and fever.

372.title: Harry Maguire 'likes' Instagram post about Ronaldo being upset at Man Utd
372.article_body: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire reportedly liked an Instagram post that claimed Cristiano Ronaldo was unhappy at the club due to the recent salary cut. Maguire has since unliked the post and has said he clicked the button in error. Earlier, it was reported that Ronaldo has told Manchester United that he wants to leave the club.

373.title: We make mistakes, can be rectified: Mamata after Mahua faces FIR over her remark
373.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "We make mistakes while working but they can be rectified." Her statement comes at a time when TMC's Mahua Moitra is facing FIRs over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "Some people don't see all the good work and suddenly start shouting...Negativity affects our brain cells so let's think positively," she added.

374.title: 53-yr-old Tripura woman clears board exams with daughters, says 'I'm happy'
374.article_body: A 53-year-old woman, Shila Rani Das, from Tripura has passed her 10th board exams at the same time when her daughters have cleared their 12th board exams. "I am happy that I've passed the exam. My daughters and other people supported me and inspired me to do it. I was confident that I will clear the exam," Das said.

375.title: Mismanagement caused DDA's liabilities to exceed ₹10,000 cr: Delhi LG
375.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Thursday said the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) owns one of the costliest chunks of real estate in the world, however, "mismanagement has led to its liabilities exceeding ₹10,000 crore". The LG tweeted a poster giving details of the financial condition of the urban body. He further invited suggestions to make the authority more "viable".

376.title: Only 3 states in India have at least one camera in each police station: Report
376.article_body: The India Justice Report, which analyses the police workforce in India, found that despite Supreme Court's order mandating CCTV cameras in all police stations, one in every three police stations does not have even a single camera. Odisha, Telangana and Puducherry were the only exceptions where all their police stations are equipped with at least one camera, the report said.

377.title: 'Kaali' director receives violent threats, says 'I don't feel safe anywhere'
377.article_body: 'Kaali' director Leena Manimekalai has alleged that she, her family and her collaborators have received thousands of threats of violence over her film's poster. "I do not feel safe anywhere at this moment," said Manimekalai. The alleged threats were sent from more than 200,000 accounts online, she said, calling it a "grand-scale mass lynching" by right-wing groups.

378.title: Canadian swimmer Harvey reveals she was drugged on last night of World C'ships
378.article_body: Canada's 22-year-old swimmer Mary-Sophie Harvey, who won bronze medal at the recently-concluded swimming World Championships in Budapest, revealed that she was drugged on the last night of the tournament. "There's this four-to-six-hour window where I can't recall a single thing," she wrote. Sharing pictures, she further revealed that she found a dozen of bruises on her body.

379.title: Was slapped by Rekha in 'Lajja', couldn't stop crying: Aarti Chabria
379.article_body: Actress Aarti Chabria said she couldn't stop crying after being slapped by actress Rekha in the film 'Lajja'. "I was [also] beaten up during [the film]," added Aarti. Discussing a scene from 'Awara Paagal Deewana' where she slaps Akshay Kumar's character, Aarti stated, "It was...an act...After I slap him, he immediately...raises his hand. That wasn't a part of the script."

380.title: Eknath Shinde officially takes charge as Maharashtra CM
380.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde formally took charge of his post at the state secretariat Mantralaya in Mumbai on Thursday. A 'puja' was held at the office of the CM before Shinde took charge. On Monday, the Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly as it surpassed the majority mark of 144.

381.title: Pune woman asked to pay electricity bill online, cheated of ₹10 lakh
381.article_body: A 53-year-old Pune-based woman allegedly lost over ₹10 lakh after a fraudster posing as a power company official asked her to pay her electricity bill online to avoid a power cut. The accused made the victim install 'Quick Support' and 'Any Desk' apps. She lost the money after she downloaded the apps and shared her phone screen with the accused.

382.title: Man rapes woman in Mumbai's hotel, threatens to leak private pics
382.article_body: A 38-year-old developer from Virar allegedly raped a 29-year-old woman in a five-star hotel in Mumbai, police said. The victim claimed the accused, who's her sister-in-law's husband, had promised to marry her and had also shot her private pictures and videos. She further alleged that he forced her to terminate her pregnancy and threatened to make her private pictures public.

383.title: Uterus transplants allow successful pregnancies in US women: Study
383.article_body: As many as 19 (58%) out of 33 women who underwent a uterus transplant in the US between 2016 and 2021 have delivered a total of 21 babies, researchers said. All the babies were delivered by Cesarean section, 14 months after the transplant on average. More than half of these babies were born after 36 weeks of gestation.

384.title: PM inaugurates 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal kitchen in Varanasi
384.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, on Thursday, inaugurated the 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal kitchen at the LT College in Varanasi, which can feed as many as 1 lakh students. As part of his visit, PM Modi will launch and lay the foundation stone for development projects worth ₹1,774 crore focused on improving infrastructure and ease of living, officials said.

385.title: Root is capable of breaking Sachin's Test tally record: Wasim Jaffer
385.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said England batter Joe Root can break Sachin Tendulkar's record of 15,921 runs in Test cricket. "Root can do it if he plays that long. He's only 31 years old...if he plays another five-six years...[then] he's capable of breaking the record," stated Jaffer. So far, Root has scored 10,458 runs in 121 Tests.

386.title: KCR didn't deliver promises, insulted PM with arrogance: BJP leader
386.article_body: BJP leader Gudur Narayana Reddy on Wednesday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao failed in delivering promises and also accused him of insulting PM Narendra Modi with sheer arrogance. Reddy said that KCR has shown utter disrespect by not receiving PM Modi at the airport and for not taking part in the programmes being attended by the PM.

387.title: B2B marketplace Zetwerk promotes Ankit Fatehpuria as 5th Co-founder
387.article_body: B2B marketplace Zetwerk has promoted Ankit Fatehpuria, who joined the startup in 2019, as the fifth Co-founder of Zetwerk. Fatehpuria established the finance function of the company and also scaled multiple business verticals for it. Founded in 2018, Zetwerk acquired the unicorn status last year after raising $150 million in its Series E round at $1.33 billion valuation.

388.title: 19-year-old woman flung in air after being hit by a car in Hyd; video surfaces
388.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was critically injured after being hit by a car in Hyderabad's Rajendranagar. In a CCTV camera video of the incident, the woman is seen walking on the side of the road when a speeding car suddenly turned towards her and hit her. The woman was flung into the air before she fell down a few metre away.

389.title: Nakuul's mom says she doesn't like his hair in 'Bade...', actor shares chat
389.article_body: Television actor Nakuul Mehta took to Instagram to share a screenshot of his chat with his mother. In the chat, his mother told him that she does not like his hair in the television serial 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2'. She asked why can't he go back to his original haircut. Mehta wrote he shared chat without his mother's consent.

390.title: Bengaluru residential unit sales jump 34% YoY in 1st quarter of 2022: Report
390.article_body: The Bengaluru residential real estate market saw its sales jump by 34% year-on-year (YoY) in the first quarter of 2022, according to global consultants Knight Frank's report. The residential real estate prices in Bengaluru also increased 7% YoY during this period, which is the highest in India. The rental levels increased by 4% in the city, as per the report.

391.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 men with demonetised currency worth ₹62 lakh
391.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday said that they have arrested two men with demonetised currency worth ₹62 lakh. One of the accused informed the police that he purchased the demonetised currency from different people after paying ₹14 lakh in the new currency. The accused said that he had planned on selling the demonetised currency for ₹20 lakh.

392.title: DTC driver shot dead by bike-borne men in front of family in Delhi
392.article_body: A 45-year-old man was shot dead by two unidentified bike-borne men in front of his family in Delhi's Govindpuri, police said on Thursday. Around 8 pm on Wednesday, the deceased, along with his wife and eight-year-old son, were returning from a market when the two men opened fire at him, a senior police officer said.

393.title: Facebook accessed deleted Messenger app data of users: Fired employee
393.article_body: A fired Facebook employee has said a new protocol allowed members of the social network's Global Escalation Team "to circumvent Facebook's normal privacy protocols" by retrieving data from Messenger app "that users had chosen to delete". Brennan Lawson said he was fired for raising alarms about the protocol. Lawson has sued Facebook's parent Meta and is seeking over $3 million.

394.title: Sensex jumps 427 points to close at 54,178; Nifty ends above 16,000-mark
394.article_body: Indices rallied on Thursday with the BSE Sensex climbing 427 points (0.8%) to close over the 54,000-mark at 54,178 and the NSE Nifty50 closing above the 16,000-mark. Nifty50 rose 143 points or 0.89% and closed at 16,133. Titan Company, Tata Steel, L&T, ICICI Bank, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Bank and M&M were among the top gainers on Thursday.

395.title: Thanks for being my biggest supporter: Raina to Dhoni on his 41st b'day
395.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina took to Twitter to wish MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday, terming him as his "biggest" supporter and mentor in "every phase of life". "Happy Birthday to my big brother...May God bless you and your family with good health always. Much love to you Mahi bhai. Wishing you a great year ahead!" added Raina.

396.title: COVID vaccination mandatory to enter some public spaces in Beijing
396.article_body: People will have to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination before entering some public places, including gyms, cinemas, museums and libraries, in the Chinese capital Beijing from Monday. The list of public places requiring vaccination does not include restaurants and offices. Over 23 million people in Beijing have been vaccinated, a spokesperson for Beijing's Municipal Health Commission said.

397.title: Class 12 girl stabbed by neighbour after an argument in Delhi
397.article_body: A Class 12 girl was allegedly stabbed in the chest and stomach by her neighbour, a 17-year-old boy, after an argument broke out between them in West Delhi's Tilak Vihar area on Thursday. DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said, "The victim and the accused...were friends for the past two-three years." Meanwhile, police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused.

398.title: BJP demands ban on PFI after police arrest 4 party activists in T'gana
398.article_body: BJP's Telangana unit has urged the Union Home Ministry to ban the Popular Front of India (PFI) after four party activists were arrested in Nizamabad. "The PFI agenda confessed by...arrested suspects...is extremely unsettling and dangerous to the religious harmony...of this nation," said BJP's chief spokesperson K Krishna Sagar Rao, while calling it a "serious plot to destabilise the society''.

399.title: Delhi Police moves HC against Ishrat Jahan's bail in 2020 riots case
399.article_body: Delhi Police moved the Delhi High Court challenging the bail granted to former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan in the larger conspiracy case of the 2020 Delhi riots. The trial court, which granted bail to Jahan, ignored the statements of protected witnesses, which "attributed a definite role" to her "not only in conspiracy but also in terror financing", Delhi Police stated.

400.title: Man returning home on bike with family from market shot dead in Delhi
400.article_body: A man returning home after purchasing food from a market with his wife and eight-year-old son was shot dead by two unknown assailants on Wednesday in southeast Delhi, police said. The family was near Deepalaya School when two persons fired at him near his right shoulder, police added. The man was rushed to a hospital where he was declared dead.

401.title: US exported 5 mn barrels of reserve oil to Asia, Europe last month amid record prices: Report
401.article_body: More than 5 million barrels of oil from the US Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) were exported to Asia and Europe last month, as per reports. This comes despite the gasoline and diesel prices hitting record highs in the US. The latest exports follow three vessels that carried SPR crude to Europe in April helping replace Russian crude supplies.

402.title: He is a brilliant co-actor: Sanya Malhotra on working with Rajkummar Rao
402.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Rajkummar Rao in 'HIT: The First Case', actress Sanya Malhotra said, "When you're working with actors like Rajkummar Rao, it becomes more collaborative. You just have to follow their lead and react to what they're doing...So, I never felt anything was...challenging." She added that he's not only a good actor but a brilliant co-actor too.
